definition.en: A steady accent on the normally weak beats in music (especially beats 2 and 4 in 4/4 time), common in rock, pop, R&B, and jazz.
definition.zh: （音乐中的）反拍；把重音放在通常较弱的拍子上（尤其是4/4拍的第2拍和第4拍），常见于摇滚、流行、R&B和爵士。

examples.en: Clap on the backbeat—on beats two and four.
examples.zh: 在反拍上拍手——也就是第2拍和第4拍。

examples.en: The drummer kept a strong backbeat that made everyone want to dance.
examples.zh: 鼓手保持了强烈的反拍，让大家都想跳舞。

examples.en: This song has a classic backbeat like early rock and roll.
examples.zh: 这首歌有典型的反拍，很像早期摇滚乐。

definition.en: To play or emphasize a backbeat in a song.
definition.zh: （在歌曲中）打出/强调反拍。

examples.en: The band backbeats through the chorus to build energy.
examples.zh: 乐队在副歌部分用反拍来增强气氛。

examples.en: Try backbeating with the snare to get a funkier feel.
examples.zh: 试着用军鼓打反拍，会更有放克的感觉。

extraExplanation: “backbeat”最常与军鼓（snare drum）联系在一起：在4/4拍里，底鼓（kick）常在第1和第3拍更突出，而军鼓在第2和第4拍打出清晰重音，就形成了典型的反拍。
它是很多20世纪流行音乐（尤其是摇滚、R&B、灵魂乐、放克）的核心律动之一，也常被用来形容“很有节奏感、让人想跟着动”的伴奏风格。

summary.en: “Backbeats” are the accented beats (usually 2 and 4) that create a driving groove in much popular music.
summary.zh: “backbeats”指常在4/4拍的第2、4拍上加重的“反拍”，能带来强烈的律动感。

definition.en: a strong accent on the second and fourth beats in a 4/4 measure (common in rock, pop, R&B, and many dance styles); plural of “backbeat.”
definition.zh: （4/4拍中）对第2拍和第4拍的重音强调（常见于摇滚、流行、节奏布鲁斯和舞曲等）；“backbeat”的复数。

examples.en: Clap on the backbeats—two and four—and you’ll feel the groove immediately.
examples.zh: 在反拍（第2拍和第4拍）上拍手——你会立刻感到律动。

examples.en: The drummer kept the backbeats steady while the guitarist played a syncopated riff.
examples.zh: 鼓手把反拍打得很稳，吉他手则弹了带切分的乐句。

examples.en: A lot of funk songs lean on tight backbeats to create a danceable feel.
examples.zh: 很多放克歌曲依靠紧凑的反拍来营造适合跳舞的感觉。

extraExplanation: “backbeat”字面是“后面的拍子”，但音乐上指的是把重音放在4/4拍的第2、4拍（相对传统进行曲/古典里更强调第1、3拍的“on the beat”）。因此它常被说成现代流行音乐的标志性律动之一。
在乐队里，反拍通常由军鼓（snare）或拍手来突出；练习时可以一边数“1-2-3-4”，一边在“2、4”用力拍手，最容易体会。

summary.en: A backbencher is usually an ordinary legislator without a top leadership role, especially in the UK Parliament; more broadly, someone who stays in the background.
summary.zh: backbencher 通常指（尤指英国议会）不担任要职的普通议员；广义上也指不出风头、处于次要位置的人。

definition.en: A member of a legislature (such as the UK Parliament) who is not a minister or a leading spokesperson; an ordinary, less prominent lawmaker.
definition.zh: （尤指英国议会）后座议员：不担任内阁部长或主要发言人的普通议员，影响力相对较小。

examples.en: Backbenchers sometimes vote against their own party to show disagreement.
examples.zh: 后座议员有时会投票反对本党，以表达不同意见。

examples.en: The prime minister faced pressure from backbenchers over the new policy.
examples.zh: 首相因新政策受到后座议员的压力。

definition.en: In a more general (non-political) sense, a person who stays in the background and is not a leader or key decision-maker.
definition.zh: （较泛指）不出风头的人；处于次要位置、不是领导或核心决策者的人。

examples.en: He was a backbencher in the organization, happy to support rather than lead.
examples.zh: 他在组织里甘当配角，乐于支持而不做领导。

extraExplanation: 这个词源于英国议会的座位安排：政府大臣和影子内阁等要员通常坐在前排（front bench），普通议员坐在后排（back benches），因此有了 backbencher（后座议员）这一称呼。
在新闻英语里它很常见，尤其与 party rebellion（党内“倒戈”/反叛投票）、constituency（选区）等词一起出现。

summary.en: Backbenchers are ordinary lawmakers, not ministers or top party spokespersons, especially in the UK Parliament.
summary.zh: Backbenchers 指（尤指英国议会中的）非内阁、非党内前排领导的普通议员。

definition.en: A member of a legislature (especially in the UK) who is not a government minister or a senior opposition spokesperson; an ordinary lawmaker who sits on the back benches.
definition.zh: （尤指英国）议会中非内阁大臣、也非反对党前排发言人的普通议员；坐在后排席位的议员。

examples.en: Backbenchers pushed the prime minister to change the policy.
examples.zh: 后座议员施压首相，要求改变这项政策。

examples.en: The bill faced criticism from backbenchers in the ruling party.
examples.zh: 这项法案遭到执政党后座议员的批评。

examples.en: Backbenchers often represent local concerns more directly than ministers do.
examples.zh: 后座议员往往比部长更直接地代表地方关切。

extraExplanation: “backbenchers”多见于英国政治语境：议会座位上，政府与反对党主要领导坐“前排（front bench）”，普通议员多坐“后排（back bench）”，因此得名。
在新闻报道里，backbenchers常带有“不是高层、但能在党内掀起压力或造反”的意味（如“backbench rebellion”后座议员反叛）。
美式英语也能理解这个词，但美国国会更常说“rank-and-file members（普通议员）”或“non-leadership members（非领导层成员）”。

summary.en: A backbend is a movement or pose where you bend your back backward; it can also be used as a verb meaning to do that movement.
summary.zh: backbend 指背部向后弯的动作或姿势（后弯/下腰）；也可作动词表示“做后弯/下腰”。

definition.en: a pose or movement where you bend your back backward, often in yoga, gymnastics, dance, or stretching
definition.zh: 后弯；下腰（一种把背部向后弯的动作/姿势，常见于瑜伽、体操、舞蹈或拉伸）

examples.en: In yoga class, we practiced a gentle backbend to open the chest.
examples.zh: 在瑜伽课上，我们练习了一个温和的后弯来打开胸腔。

examples.en: She held the backbend for five seconds, then returned to standing.
examples.zh: 她保持下腰五秒钟，然后回到站立。

examples.en: A deep backbend can strain your lower back if you don’t warm up first.
examples.zh: 如果不先热身，深度后弯可能会拉伤下背部。

definition.en: to bend the back backward
definition.zh: 做后弯；下腰（把背部向后弯）

examples.en: Try not to backbend too quickly—move slowly and breathe.
examples.zh: 下腰不要太快——慢慢来并保持呼吸。

examples.en: He can backbend easily after years of gymnastics training.
examples.zh: 经过多年体操训练，他下腰很轻松。

extraExplanation: “backbend”常作为瑜伽/舞蹈/体操术语使用。瑜伽里常见的后弯包括：cobra pose（眼镜蛇式）、bridge pose（桥式）、camel pose（骆驼式）、wheel pose（轮式/全轮式）。日常英语里也可说“do a backbend”。

summary.en: Backbends are deep backward bends of the body, often done in yoga or gymnastics.
summary.zh: Backbends 指身体深度向后弯的动作，常见于瑜伽或体操等。

definition.en: a deep bend of the body backward (a common movement in yoga, gymnastics, dance, and cheerleading)
definition.zh: 后弯；下腰（身体向后大幅度弯曲的动作，常见于瑜伽、体操、舞蹈等）

examples.en: She practiced backbends to improve her flexibility.
examples.zh: 她练习下腰来提高柔韧性。

examples.en: In yoga class, we did gentle backbends to open the chest.
examples.zh: 在瑜伽课上，我们做了温和的后弯来打开胸腔。

examples.en: Full backbends can be risky if you don’t warm up first.
examples.zh: 如果不先热身，完整的下腰可能有风险。

definition.en: to bend your body backward deeply
definition.zh: 做后弯；下腰（把身体深度向后弯）

examples.en: He can backbend without using his hands.
examples.zh: 他不用手也能下腰。

examples.en: Try not to backbend too quickly—move slowly and breathe.
examples.zh: 尽量不要下腰太快——慢慢来并保持呼吸。

extraExplanation: “backbends”是复数形式，单数是“backbend”。在瑜伽语境里，常见的相关动作还包括“cobra pose（眼镜蛇式）”“bridge pose（桥式）”“wheel pose（轮式/全轮）”。这些都属于后弯类动作，但强度不同。

summary.en: “Back burner” = lower priority; to postpone something for later.
summary.zh: “back burner”= 优先级较低；把事情暂时延后/搁置。

definition.en: (Common correction) “back burner” refers to something you delay or give lower priority so you can focus on more urgent matters.
definition.zh: （常见纠正）“back burner”指把某事暂时搁置、降低优先级，以便先处理更紧急的事情。

examples.en: Let’s put the redesign on the back burner until we finish the bug fixes.
examples.zh: 我们先把改版这件事放一放，等修完漏洞再说。

examples.en: His travel plans are on the back burner because of work.
examples.zh: 因为工作原因，他的旅行计划被搁置了。

definition.en: “Put something on the back burner” means to postpone dealing with something (often temporarily).
definition.zh: “put something on the back burner”意思是把某事暂时延后处理（通常是暂时的）。

examples.en: She put her master’s degree on the back burner to save money.
examples.zh: 她为了攒钱，暂时搁置了读硕士的计划。

examples.en: We can’t put safety on the back burner.
examples.zh: 安全问题不能被搁置。

extraExplanation: “back burner”来自烹饪场景：炉子后面的火通常较小、较不显眼，适合让食物慢慢煨着；比喻“不是当前最重要的事”。
你输入的“backberand”不是常见英文单词，最接近的常用表达很可能是“back burner”。如果你想表达别的意思（比如“后弯 backbend”或“品牌 brand”相关），告诉我你要表达的中文意思，我可以帮你确认正确拼写。

summary.en: “backberend” is not a recognized English word; it’s probably a misspelling (e.g., “backbend” or “back burner”).
summary.zh: “backberend”不是规范英语单词；多半是拼写错误（例如“backbend”或“back burner”）。

definition.en: Not a standard English word. It is likely a misspelling of another word or phrase.
definition.zh: 不是标准英语单词，可能是其他单词或短语的拼写错误。

examples.en: I can’t find “backberend” in a dictionary—did you mean “backbend” or “back burner”?
examples.zh: 我在词典里找不到“backberend”——你想写的是“backbend”还是“back burner”吗？

extraExplanation:
“backberend”在常见英语词典中没有收录，通常需要你确认想表达的词：
1) backbend /ˈbækˌbɛnd/：体操/瑜伽里的“下腰、后弯”。
2) back burner：习语，表示“暂时搁置、放一放（优先级降低）”。常见说法是 put something on the back burner。
如果你告诉我它出现的句子或语境（比如聊天、作业、文章），我可以帮你精准判断是哪一个。

summary.en: “Backbit” means “spoke unkindly about someone behind their back” (past of backbite).
summary.zh: “backbit”表示“在背后说某人坏话/恶意批评”（backbite的过去式/过去分词）。

definition.en: past tense and past participle of “backbite”: to talk about someone in a cruel or unfair way when they are not present; to criticize or spread unkind gossip behind someone’s back.
definition.zh: “backbite”的过去式和过去分词：在别人不在场时说坏话；在背后恶意批评或散布不友善的流言。

examples.en: He backbit his coworkers in meetings when they weren’t there to defend themselves.
examples.zh: 他在同事不在场、无法为自己辩护时，在会议上背后说他们的坏话。

examples.en: She regretted that she had backbit her friend out of jealousy.
examples.zh: 她后悔自己因为嫉妒而在背后说朋友坏话。

examples.en: Our teacher reminded us not to backbite, because it hurts trust in the group.
examples.zh: 老师提醒我们不要背后说人坏话，因为那会伤害团队中的信任。

extraExplanation: “backbit”是动词“backbite”的不规则变化形式之一：backbite – backbit – backbitten（更常见的过去分词也可用backbit）。
“backbite”在语气上通常比普通的“gossip（八卦）”更负面，强调恶意、刻薄或不公平的批评。

summary.en: Backbite means to speak unkindly about someone when they are not there.
summary.zh: Backbite 指在当事人不在场时背后说坏话、诋毁对方。

definition.en: to talk about someone in a mean or unfair way when they are not present; to speak badly of someone behind their back
definition.zh: （背后）诋毁、说坏话；背地里中伤别人

examples.en: It’s wrong to backbite your coworkers just to look better.
examples.zh: 为了显得自己更好而背后诋毁同事是不对的。

examples.en: She smiled in public, but she would backbite people later.
examples.zh: 她在公开场合微笑示人，但之后会背后说别人坏话。

examples.en: Try not to backbite—talk to the person directly if there’s a problem.
examples.zh: 尽量别背后说坏话——有问题就直接和当事人沟通。

definition.en: to bite someone on the back (rare; usually literal or animal-related)
definition.zh: 咬某人的背部（较少见；通常为字面或与动物相关）

examples.en: The dog may backbite if it feels threatened from behind.
examples.zh: 如果从后方感到威胁，这只狗可能会咬人背部。

extraExplanation: 在日常英语里，backbite 几乎总是比喻义，接近 speak ill of / badmouth / gossip about（多带负面评价）。更常见的名词是 backbiting（背后诋毁、搬弄是非），例如：Office backbiting can ruin teamwork（职场背后中伤会破坏团队合作）。
这个词在宗教与道德语境（如讲道、劝诫文章）中出现较多，用来强调“背后伤人”的不道德性。

summary.en: A backbiter is someone who criticizes or speaks badly about others behind their backs.
summary.zh: backbiter 指在别人不在场时背后批评、诋毁他人的人。

definition.en: a person who says unkind or harmful things about someone who is not present; someone who talks behind others’ backs
definition.zh: 背后说人坏话的人；诽谤者（当事人不在场时）

examples.en: Be careful what you share with him—he’s a backbiter.
examples.zh: 跟他分享事情要小心——他很爱背后说人坏话。

examples.en: She left the group chat because she was tired of the backbiters.
examples.zh: 她退出群聊，因为受够了那些背后议论人的人。

examples.en: In the office, backbiters can quickly ruin trust.
examples.zh: 在办公室里，背后嚼舌根的人会很快破坏信任。

extraExplanation: “backbiter”来自短语“bite someone’s back”（在背后咬人），意思是当面不说、背后中伤。常见的近义表达有“talk behind someone’s back”（背后议论）和“badmouth”（说坏话）。
语气通常比较负面、带有道德批评；比中性的“gossiper”（爱八卦的人）更强调“伤人/诋毁”的成分。

summary.en: Backbiters are people who criticize or gossip about others behind their backs.
summary.zh: backbiters 指在背后批评、诋毁或散布八卦的人。

definition.en: People who talk badly about someone who is not present; people who spread unkind gossip or criticism behind someone’s back.
definition.zh: 背后说人坏话的人；造谣中伤者；背后诋毁他人的人。

examples.en: She avoided the backbiters at work and kept her distance from office gossip.
examples.zh: 她躲开公司里的那些背后说坏话的人，和办公室八卦保持距离。

examples.en: Backbiters can damage a team’s trust very quickly.
examples.zh: 背后诋毁他人的人会很快破坏团队的信任。

examples.en: If you hear backbiters, don’t pass the story on.
examples.zh: 如果你听到别人背后嚼舌根，就别再把这话传下去。

synonyms: people who talk behind someone’s back
extraExplanation: “backbiter”来自动词短语“to backbite”（在背后诋毁/中伤）。这个词在宗教或较正式的语境里也常见，例如《圣经》英语译本中曾用“backbiting/backbiters”指背后毁谤他人。日常口语里更常说“gossips”“people who talk behind your back”。

summary.en: “Backbites” means “speaks negatively about someone behind their back.”
summary.zh: “backbites”表示“在别人背后说坏话、恶意议论/中伤”。

definition.en: (of someone) speaks unkindly or critically about a person who is not present; gossips maliciously.
definition.zh: （指某人）在当事人不在场时背后说坏话；恶意中伤、诽谤。

examples.en: She backbites her coworkers when they aren’t in the room.
examples.zh: 同事不在时，她就背后说他们的坏话。

examples.en: If he backbites his friends, it’s hard to trust him.
examples.zh: 如果他会背后说朋友坏话，就很难信任他。

examples.en: The manager reminded the team not to backbite and to raise problems directly.
examples.zh: 经理提醒团队不要背后中伤，有问题要当面沟通。

extraExplanation: “backbites”是动词“backbite”的第三人称单数现在时（he/she/it backbites）。过去式和过去分词常见为“backbit/ backbitten”（两种都可能见到），现在分词为“backbiting”。
“backbite”比一般的“talk about someone”更负面，强调不友善、带攻击性的闲话；在正式语境里也常用“slander/defame”表示更严重的诽谤（可能涉及法律）。

summary.en: “Backbiting” means speaking maliciously about someone behind their back (noun) or doing that (verb).
summary.zh: “backbiting”指在别人背后恶意议论、中伤（作名词或动词）。

definition.en: unkind or malicious talk about someone who is not present; gossip that criticizes someone behind their back
definition.zh: 背后说人坏话；恶意中伤式的闲话（当事人不在场时）

examples.en: Backbiting at work can quickly damage trust in a team.
examples.zh: 在职场背后说人坏话会很快破坏团队信任。

examples.en: She was tired of the backbiting and decided to leave the group chat.
examples.zh: 她厌倦了那些背后议论，决定退出群聊。

definition.en: to talk unkindly about someone who is not present; to criticize or spread negative stories behind someone’s back
definition.zh: 背后说人坏话；在背后批评或散布负面传闻

examples.en: It’s easy to backbite when you’re upset, but it rarely solves anything.
examples.zh: 生气时很容易在背后说人坏话，但这很少能解决问题。

examples.en: Don’t backbite your classmates—talk to them directly if there’s a problem.
examples.zh: 别在背后议论同学；有问题就当面沟通。

extraExplanation: “backbiting”由 back（背后）+ bite（咬）构成，形象地表达“在别人背后咬一口”的感觉，即暗中伤害名誉。常见于关于人际关系、办公室政治、社交圈冲突等语境。
近义词里，gossip 更中性（也可能只是八卦），而 backbiting / badmouthing 更强调恶意与伤害。更正式一点也可说 speak ill of someone。

summary.en: “Backbitingly” means speaking about someone maliciously when they are not present.
summary.zh: “backbitingly”指在当事人不在场时恶意议论或诋毁对方（背后中伤）。

definition.en: In a backbiting way; by speaking unkindly or maliciously about someone who is not present (gossiping or criticizing behind their back).
definition.zh: 以背后中伤的方式；在当事人不在场时恶意议论、诋毁（在背后说坏话）。

examples.en: They smiled politely in public but spoke backbitingly about her after she left.
examples.zh: 他们在公众场合客气地微笑，但她一离开就背后恶意议论她。

examples.en: The comment was written backbitingly, aiming to damage his reputation without evidence.
examples.zh: 那条评论带着背后中伤的意味，意在在没有证据的情况下损害他的名声。

examples.en: Try not to talk backbitingly about coworkers; it hurts trust in the team.
examples.zh: 尽量不要背后说同事坏话；这会伤害团队的信任。

extraExplanation: “backbitingly”来自动词“backbite”（背后诋毁、说坏话）。“bite”在这里是比喻用法，像“咬人”一样伤害别人名誉。这个词语气偏强，带明显道德评价，常用于批评刻薄的闲言碎语。
在文学或宗教语境中也常见对“backbiting（背后中伤）”的谴责，强调它破坏人际关系与社区信任。

summary.en: Backbitten means “slandered behind one’s back,” and it can also be the past participle of backbite.
summary.zh: backbitten 指“被人在背后诽谤/中伤的”，也可作 backbite（背后诋毁）的过去分词。

definition.en: slandered or spoken about maliciously when not present; criticized behind one’s back.
definition.zh: 被人在背后恶意议论或诽谤的；遭到背后中伤的。

examples.en: She felt hurt and backbitten after hearing the rumors at work.
examples.zh: 听到同事在办公室传的流言后，她感到受伤，觉得自己被人背后中伤了。

examples.en: In a small town, it’s easy to become backbitten if you stand out.
examples.zh: 在小镇上，如果你很显眼，就很容易被人背后议论。

definition.en: (Past participle of backbite) to have spoken spitefully about someone who is not present.
definition.zh: （backbite 的过去分词）在当事人不在场时恶意议论/诽谤过某人。

examples.en: He admitted he had backbitten his teammate during a stressful week.
examples.zh: 他承认自己在压力很大的一周里背后诋毁过队友。

examples.en: If you’ve backbitten someone, it’s better to apologize directly.
examples.zh: 如果你背后说过某人坏话，最好直接道歉。

extraExplanation: “backbite”直译像“从背后咬人”，形象地表达“背后中伤”。这个词在英语里常带有道德批评意味，类似于中文的“背后捅刀子/说人坏话”。
在一些宗教或文学语境中，backbiting（背后毁谤）常被当作一种不良品行来谴责；因此“backbitten”不仅表示“被议论”，也常暗示“被不公正地议论”。

summary.en: “Backblocks” means the very remote rural areas, especially in NZ/Aus English.
summary.zh: “backblocks”指非常偏远的乡村地区，尤其常见于新西兰/澳大利亚英语。

definition.en: remote, sparsely populated countryside; the most out-of-the-way rural areas (common in New Zealand and Australia English).
definition.zh: 偏远的乡村地区；人烟稀少的内陆（常见于新西兰、澳大利亚英语）。

examples.en: He grew up in the backblocks, far from the nearest town.
examples.zh: 他在偏远乡下长大，离最近的城镇都很远。

examples.en: The doctor has to travel for hours to reach people in the backblocks.
examples.zh: 医生得开好几个小时，才能到达偏远地区的居民那里。

examples.en: They moved to the backblocks for a quieter life.
examples.zh: 他们搬到偏远乡下去过更安静的生活。

extraExplanation: “backblocks”多用于新西兰/澳大利亚语境，带有一种“很偏、很难到达”的感觉，常与农场、内陆、公路不便等画面联系在一起。美式英语里更常用的说法有“the boondocks / the sticks / the backcountry”。

summary.en: Backblow means a backward blast of force, or a harmful reaction that comes back against the one who caused it.
summary.zh: Backblow 指“反向冲击/回喷”，也可比喻“反噬、负面回击”。

definition.en: a backward blast or return of pressure, flame, or force (for example in an explosion, a gun, or a machine)
definition.zh: （爆炸、枪械或机器等造成的）反向冲击；回喷；回冲气浪

examples.en: The workers sheltered behind a wall to avoid a backblow from the blast.
examples.zh: 工人们躲在墙后，以避免爆破产生的回冲气浪。

examples.en: Improper ventilation can cause a dangerous backblow in a tunnel.
examples.zh: 通风不当可能会在隧道里引发危险的回喷。

definition.en: a negative reaction or unintended harmful effect that comes back on the person or group who caused something (backlash)
definition.zh: （对某行为的）反噬；负面回击（类似 backlash）

examples.en: The harsh policy created a public backblow against the officials.
examples.zh: 这项严厉的政策引发了公众对官员的反噬情绪。

examples.en: He didn’t expect the joke to have such a strong backblow online.
examples.zh: 他没想到这个玩笑会在网上招来这么强烈的反噬。

extraExplanation: “backblow”字面意思是“向后吹/向后冲”。在工程、采矿、爆破等语境里更常见，指爆炸或高压气体的冲击波回到原处，可能伤人。比喻用法较少见，但可表达“造成某事后反过来受到伤害/反对”。

summary.en: A backboard is usually the board behind a basketball hoop; it can also mean a supporting board placed behind something.
summary.zh: backboard 通常指篮球的篮板；也可指用于支撑或保护的背板/衬板。

definition.en: a board behind a basketball hoop that the rim is attached to; it helps shots rebound
definition.zh: 篮球篮筐后面的篮板；用于固定篮筐并帮助投篮反弹

examples.en: He banked the shot off the backboard and scored.
examples.zh: 他把球打板投进了。

examples.en: The ball hit the backboard but didn’t go in.
examples.zh: 球打到了篮板上，但没进。

definition.en: a flat board placed behind something to support it or protect a surface
definition.zh: （物体后面的）衬板/背板；用于支撑或保护表面

examples.en: Put a backboard behind the poster so it won’t bend.
examples.zh: 在海报后面垫一块背板，这样就不会弯了。

examples.en: The sink is mounted with a backboard to protect the wall from water.
examples.zh: 水槽安装了挡水背板，用来保护墙面不被水溅湿。

extraExplanation: 在篮球语境里，backboard 常和 rim（篮筐/篮圈）、backboard shot / bank shot（打板投篮）一起出现。口语里也会说 “off the glass”（借助篮板进球），glass 指的是透明篮板。

summary.en: Backboards are most commonly the boards behind basketball hoops; the word can also mean a rigid board used to immobilize someone’s back or a backing board in furniture.
summary.zh: backboards 最常指篮球篮板；也可指急救用的脊柱固定板，或家具/设备中的背板。

definition.en: a board behind a basketball hoop that the ball can bounce off; it holds the rim in place
definition.zh: （篮球）篮板；篮筐后面的板，用来固定篮圈并让球反弹

examples.en: He banked the shot off the backboard.
examples.zh: 他把球打板投进了。

examples.en: The gym replaced the old glass backboards.
examples.zh: 体育馆更换了旧的玻璃篮板。

examples.en: Aim for the top corner of the square on the backboard.
examples.zh: 瞄准篮板上小方框的上角。

definition.en: a rigid board used to support or immobilize a person’s back, especially in emergency medical care
definition.zh: （急救）脊柱固定板；用于固定伤者背部的硬板

examples.en: Paramedics strapped him to a backboard as a precaution.
examples.zh: 急救人员把他固定在脊柱板上以防万一。

examples.en: She was lifted onto a backboard after the fall.
examples.zh: 她摔倒后被抬上了固定板。

definition.en: a flat board used as a backing or support in furniture or equipment (for example, in some beds or cabinets)
definition.zh: （家具/设备）背板；用于支撑或加固的板

examples.en: The bed’s backboard helps keep the mattress in place.
examples.zh: 床的背板有助于固定床垫。

examples.en: The cabinet backboard was warped from moisture.
examples.zh: 柜子的背板因受潮而变形。

extraExplanation: “backboard(s)”最常见于篮球语境；口语里常说“bank a shot”（打板投篮）。
医疗语境中的 backboard 指“脊柱固定板”，常与“neck brace/cervical collar（颈托）”一起出现。

summary.en: Backbone means the spine, or figuratively the main support of something, or the courage to stand firm.
summary.zh: Backbone 指“脊柱/脊椎”，也可比喻为“支柱/骨干”，还可指“骨气/勇气（坚定不退缩）”。

definition.en: The spine; the row of bones in your back that supports your body.
definition.zh: 脊柱；脊椎（支撑身体的背部骨骼）

examples.en: He hurt his backbone while lifting a heavy box.
examples.zh: 他搬重箱子时伤到了脊椎。

examples.en: The doctor checked her backbone and posture.
examples.zh: 医生检查了她的脊柱和姿势。

definition.en: The main support or most important part of a system, organization, or plan.
definition.zh: （组织、体系或计划的）支柱；骨干；主干

examples.en: Small businesses are the backbone of the local economy.
examples.zh: 小企业是当地经济的支柱。

examples.en: Trust is the backbone of a healthy relationship.
examples.zh: 信任是健康关系的基础。

examples.en: This database is the backbone of our website.
examples.zh: 这个数据库是我们网站的核心支撑。

definition.en: Strength of character; courage to act firmly, especially in a difficult situation.
definition.zh: 骨气；脊梁；勇气（在困难时坚定行动的品质）

examples.en: It takes backbone to admit you were wrong.
examples.zh: 承认自己错了需要骨气。

examples.en: She showed backbone by standing up to the bully.
examples.zh: 她勇敢反抗霸凌者，表现出很有骨气。

extraExplanation: “backbone”在比喻用法中非常常见，常见结构是“the backbone of + 名词”，意思是“……的支柱/骨干”。在中文里常译为“脊梁”“支柱”“骨干”，根据语境选择更自然的说法。
文化语感上，“have (a) backbone”强调有原则、有担当、不轻易妥协；接近中文的“有骨气/有脊梁”。

summary.en: “Backboned” means courageous and strong-willed; less commonly, it means having a backbone (a vertebrate).
summary.zh: “backboned”指有骨气、坚定勇敢；较少见时也指“有脊椎的”（脊椎动物）。

definition.en: Having a strong character; courageous, determined, and not easily controlled or intimidated.
definition.zh: 有骨气的；有主见且坚定的；不易被吓倒或左右的。

examples.en: She’s a backboned leader who won’t compromise on safety.
examples.zh: 她是个有骨气的领导者，在安全问题上绝不妥协。

examples.en: The team needs someone more backboned to speak up in meetings.
examples.zh: 团队需要更有主见的人在会议上敢于发声。

definition.en: (Biology, less common) Having a backbone; being a vertebrate.
definition.zh: （生物学，较少见）有脊椎的；属于脊椎动物的。

examples.en: Humans are backboned animals (vertebrates).
examples.zh: 人类是有脊椎的动物（脊椎动物）。

examples.en: Backboned species tend to have internal skeletons.
examples.zh: 有脊椎的物种往往有内骨骼。

extraExplanation: “backboned”来自名词 backbone（脊梁、骨气）+ 形容词后缀 -ed，表示“具有……的”。日常英语里更常用的说法是 “strong-willed / courageous / have backbone”；“backboned”带一点强调或文学/修辞色彩。
在生物学语境里，“backboned”有时用来替代 “vertebrate（脊椎动物）”，但更标准、常见的术语仍是 vertebrate / vertebrates。

summary.en: Backboneless means either “spineless/weak-willed” (most common) or literally “without a backbone.”
summary.zh: backboneless 可指“没骨气、软弱的”（更常用），也可指字面“无脊椎的”。

definition.en: Lacking courage, firmness, or moral strength; spineless; easily controlled or intimidated.
definition.zh: 缺乏勇气或骨气的；软弱的；没有主见、容易被左右的。

examples.en: He made a backboneless apology and changed his story again.
examples.zh: 他道了一个软弱无力的歉，又一次改口。

examples.en: The committee’s backboneless decision disappointed many people.
examples.zh: 委员会软弱的决定让很多人失望。

examples.en: She refused to be backboneless under pressure.
examples.zh: 她拒绝在压力下变得没骨气。

definition.en: (Literal) Without a backbone or spine; not having a backbone structure.
definition.zh: （字面）没有脊椎/脊柱的；无脊骨结构的。

examples.en: Jellyfish are backboneless animals.
examples.zh: 水母是无脊椎动物。

examples.en: The museum exhibits several backboneless sea creatures.
examples.zh: 博物馆展出了几种无脊椎海洋生物。

extraExplanation: “backbone”在英语里常用来比喻“骨气、脊梁、主心骨”。因此 backboneless 除了字面“无脊椎”，更常见的是比喻义“没骨气/没担当”。常见近义表达有 spineless（没骨气的）、weak-kneed（畏缩的）、gutless（没胆量的，较口语且更尖刻）。

summary.en: Backbonelessness means a lack of courage or firm principles—being “spineless.”
summary.zh: backbonelessness 指缺乏勇气或原则立场，形容“没骨气/意志薄弱”。

definition.en: Lack of courage, determination, or moral strength; the quality of being weak-willed or easily influenced.
definition.zh: 缺乏勇气、决心或道德骨气；意志薄弱、容易被左右的状态。

examples.en: Voters were frustrated by the senator’s backbonelessness when he avoided taking a clear position.
examples.zh: 选民对那位参议员的缺乏骨气感到沮丧，因为他总是回避表明明确立场。

examples.en: She realized that her silence in that moment felt like backbonelessness, not kindness.
examples.zh: 她意识到自己当时的沉默更像是没有骨气，而不是善良。

examples.en: The coach said the team didn’t lose because of skill, but because of backbonelessness under pressure.
examples.zh: 教练说球队输球不是因为技术，而是因为在压力下缺乏硬气与担当。

extraExplanation: “backbone（脊梁骨）”在英语里常用作隐喻，表示人的骨气、原则与坚定立场；因此“backbonelessness”就是“没有脊梁”的抽象名词，用来批评一个人缺乏担当、容易妥协或不敢坚持立场。
这个词比较少见，写作和评论里更常用的表达是“spinelessness（懦弱/没骨气）”或“lack of backbone（缺乏骨气）”。

summary.en: “Backbones” is the plural of “backbone,” meaning the spine, or figuratively the main support of something, or courage/strength of character.
summary.zh: “backbones”是“backbone”的复数，指“脊椎/脊柱”，也可比喻为“支柱/骨干”或“骨气/勇气”。

definition.en: the bones of the spine; the spinal column (especially in animals with a spine)
definition.zh: 脊椎；脊柱（尤指有脊椎动物的脊骨）

examples.en: Humans and many animals have a backbone.
examples.zh: 人类和许多动物都有脊椎。

examples.en: The injury affected his backbone, so he needed surgery.
examples.zh: 这次受伤伤到了他的脊椎，所以需要手术。

definition.en: the main support or most important part of a system, organization, or plan
definition.zh: 支柱；骨干；核心（指体系、组织或计划中最重要的部分）

examples.en: Small businesses are the backbone of the local economy.
examples.zh: 小企业是当地经济的支柱。

examples.en: This database is the backbone of our app.
examples.zh: 这个数据库是我们应用的核心。

definition.en: courage and strength of character; the ability to stand up for what is right
definition.zh: 骨气；勇气；意志力（敢于坚持正确的事）

examples.en: It takes backbone to say no to peer pressure.
examples.zh: 对同伴压力说“不”需要骨气。

examples.en: She showed backbone by speaking up in the meeting.
examples.zh: 她在会议上勇敢发言，表现出很强的骨气。

extraExplanation: “backbones”是“backbone”的复数形式。字面意思是“背部的骨头/脊椎”，引申义很常见：①“支柱/骨干”（the backbone of…）②“骨气/胆量”（have backbone, show backbone）。
常见搭配：the backbone of the country/economy/team（国家/经济/团队的支柱）；lack backbone（缺乏骨气）；put some backbone into…（让……更有力量/更坚定）。

summary.en: Backbrand means a brand mark on an animal’s back, or the act of putting that mark there (ranching usage).
summary.zh: Backbrand 指牲畜背部的烙印，或在背上烙印的行为（多用于北美牧场语境）。

definition.en: to put a brand mark on an animal’s back (usually to show ownership), or to place an additional/secondary brand on the back
definition.zh: （多指在牧场）在牲畜背上烙印（通常表示归属），或在背部加烙一个补充/次要的烙印

examples.en: The rancher decided to backbrand the calves before moving them to the summer pasture.
examples.zh: 牧场主决定在把小牛转到夏季牧场前先在它们背上烙印。

examples.en: Some ranches backbrand animals with a small mark to show the year or the herd.
examples.zh: 有些牧场会在牲畜背上加烙一个小标记，用来表示年份或所属畜群。

definition.en: a brand mark placed on the back of an animal
definition.zh: （牲畜背部的）烙印；背烙标记

examples.en: The horse had a clear backbrand that identified the ranch.
examples.zh: 那匹马背上的烙印很清楚，能辨认出来自哪个牧场。

examples.en: The inspector recorded the backbrand in the livestock logbook.
examples.zh: 检查员把背烙标记登记在牲畜记录簿里。

extraExplanation: “backbrand”主要出现在北美牧场语境中，属于比较专业、使用范围较窄的词。更常见的表达是“to brand cattle”或“a brand”。
不同牧场对烙印位置有不同习惯：肩部、臀部（hip brand）、肋部等；“backbrand”强调位置在背部。现代也可能用耳标、芯片等方式替代或辅助烙印。

summary.en: A “backbreaker” is a very physically exhausting task (or something very tiring), and it can also mean a wrestling move that targets the back.
summary.zh: backbreaker 指“非常耗体力、累人的苦活/重活”（也可作形容词表示“累人的”），在摔跤等语境中还可指针对背部的招式。

definition.en: Something (a task, job, or activity) that is extremely hard physical work; backbreaking labor.
definition.zh: （任务/工作/活动）非常辛苦、需要大量体力的活；累断腰的苦差事。

examples.en: Digging trenches by hand is a real backbreaker.
examples.zh: 用手挖沟真是个累断腰的苦差事。

examples.en: During harvest season, farm work can be a backbreaker.
examples.zh: 在收获季，农活可能非常辛苦。

examples.en: They introduced machines to reduce the backbreakers on the job.
examples.zh: 他们引进机器来减少工作中那些最累人的活。

definition.en: Causing extreme physical strain; very tiring to the body.
definition.zh: 使人极度劳累的；累人的（尤指体力上）。

examples.en: It’s backbreaker work, so take breaks and lift safely.
examples.zh: 这活很累人，所以要休息并注意正确搬运。

examples.en: Moving furniture up three flights of stairs is backbreaker labor.
examples.zh: 把家具搬上三层楼的楼梯是非常累人的体力活。

definition.en: In wrestling or combat sports, a move intended to injure or strongly strain an opponent’s back.
definition.zh: （摔跤/格斗）“折背”类招式：意在伤害或强烈压迫对手背部的动作。

examples.en: The wrestler tried a backbreaker to weaken his opponent.
examples.zh: 那名摔跤手试图用一记“折背”来削弱对手。

examples.en: Some backbreakers are illegal in certain competitions.
examples.zh: 在某些比赛中，一些“折背”动作是被禁止的。

extraExplanation: “backbreaker / backbreaking”常用于口语或写作中，强调“体力上把人累坏”的程度，语气比“hard work”更强。常见搭配：a real backbreaker, backbreaker of a job, backbreaking labor/work。
字面意思是“弄断背的东西/事”，属于夸张说法（hyperbole），一般不表示真的把背弄断。
在摔跤语境中，backbreaker 是特定技术动作名称；在日常语境里则多指“苦活、重体力活”。

summary.en: Backbreaking describes work or a schedule that is extremely exhausting, especially physically.
summary.zh: backbreaking 形容极其辛苦、令人筋疲力尽的工作或安排，尤指体力劳动。

definition.en: Extremely hard and tiring; requiring a lot of physical effort.
definition.zh: 极其辛苦的；累断腰的（需要大量体力劳动的）

examples.en: Farm work can be backbreaking during harvest season.
examples.zh: 收获季节的农活可能非常辛苦。

examples.en: They did backbreaking labor carrying bricks under the hot sun.
examples.zh: 他们在烈日下搬砖，做着非常吃力的体力活。

definition.en: So difficult or exhausting that it feels like it could “break” someone’s strength or spirit.
definition.zh: 极度艰难、令人筋疲力尽的（让人感觉快撑不住）

examples.en: After months of backbreaking training, she finally passed the test.
examples.zh: 经过数月艰苦训练，她终于通过了测试。

examples.en: The backbreaking schedule left him no time to rest.
examples.zh: 这个令人疲惫不堪的日程让他没有时间休息。

extraExplanation: 这个词是由 back（背部）+ breaking（打破/折断）组成的夸张表达，强调“辛苦到像把背都累断了”。常用来形容体力劳动（如搬运、农活、建筑工地），也可引申到非常耗精力的训练或工作。
语气通常偏负面，带有同情或批评意味：暗示工作强度不合理或代价很大。

summary.en: “Backcap” means a cap worn backward, and it can also mean to wear a cap backward.
summary.zh: “backcap”指反戴的帽子，也可作动词表示把帽子反戴。

definition.en: a cap (usually a baseball cap) worn backward, with the brim facing the back of the head
definition.zh: 反戴的帽子（通常指棒球帽），帽檐朝后

examples.en: He showed up in a backcap and a hoodie.
examples.zh: 他戴着反戴的棒球帽和连帽衫出现了。

examples.en: Wearing a backcap was popular among skaters in the 1990s.
examples.zh: 在20世纪90年代，滑板圈里反戴帽子很流行。

definition.en: to wear a cap backward
definition.zh: 把帽子反过来戴（帽檐朝后）

examples.en: Some students backcap to look more casual.
examples.zh: 有些学生会把帽子反戴，让自己看起来更随意。

examples.en: He backcapped his hat before stepping onto the court.
examples.zh: 他上场前把帽子反戴了。

extraExplanation: “backcap”更像口语或小圈子用词，日常英语里更常说：wear a cap backward / wear your cap backwards。
在美国流行文化中（如滑板、嘻哈、街头风格），反戴棒球帽常被用来表达随性、酷、叛逆或运动休闲的感觉；但在一些正式场合可能被认为不够得体。

summary.en: Backcast/backcasting means planning by starting with a future goal and working backward to today.
summary.zh: backcast/backcasting 指从未来目标出发倒推到今天来做规划。

definition.en: A forecast made by working backward from a desired future goal to the present, to plan the steps needed.
definition.zh: 从期望的未来目标倒推到现在所做的预测/规划，用来确定实现目标所需的步骤。

examples.en: We used backcasting to plan how the city can reach net-zero emissions by 2050.
examples.zh: 我们用倒推规划来制定城市如何在2050年前实现净零排放。

examples.en: Backcasting starts with the target and then asks what must happen each year to get there.
examples.zh: 倒推规划先确定目标，然后再问：为了到达目标，每一年必须发生什么？

definition.en: To plan by starting with a future goal and working backward to identify actions needed now.
definition.zh: 用“从未来目标倒推到现在”的方式来规划，找出当下需要采取的行动。

examples.en: The team backcasted from a 2030 deadline to set yearly milestones.
examples.zh: 团队从2030年的截止期倒推，设定了每年的里程碑。

examples.en: If we backcast, we can see which resources we need immediately.
examples.zh: 如果我们倒推规划，就能看出哪些资源是我们立刻需要的。

extraExplanation: “backcasting”常见于政策、可持续发展、能源转型、企业战略等语境；它与forecasting（从现在推测未来）相反：backcasting（从未来目标倒推现在）。
拼写上也常见作 back-cast / back casting；作动词时既可写 backcast，也有人用 backcasted（更口语/较少见），有时也会把过去式写成 backcast。

summary.en: Backcasts are plans or scenarios created by starting from a desired future and working backward to the present.
summary.zh: backcasts 指从理想未来出发倒推到现在所形成的规划或情景方案。

definition.en: plural of backcast: a planning/forecasting method that starts by defining a desired future outcome and then works backward to identify steps needed to reach it.
definition.zh: backcast 的复数：一种规划/预测方法，先设定想要达到的未来目标，再从未来倒推回现在，找出实现目标所需的步骤。

examples.en: The team presented three backcasts for reaching net-zero emissions by 2050.
examples.zh: 团队展示了三种倒推情景，用于实现2050年净零排放。

examples.en: We compared different backcasts to see which pathway was most realistic.
examples.zh: 我们比较了不同的倒推方案，看看哪条路径最现实。

definition.en: third-person singular of backcast: to plan by working backward from a chosen future goal to the present.
definition.zh: backcast 的第三人称单数：从设定的未来目标出发倒推到现在，用于制定计划或路径。

examples.en: She backcasts from a 2030 target and identifies the yearly milestones.
examples.zh: 她从2030年的目标倒推，并确定每年的里程碑。

examples.en: The report backcasts the steps needed to cut traffic deaths in half.
examples.zh: 报告倒推实现交通死亡人数减半所需的步骤。

extraExplanation: “Backcasting（倒推法）”常用于可持续发展、能源转型、城市规划等：先问“我们想要的未来是什么样？”，再问“从现在到那里需要做什么？”。这和 forecasting（预测）相反：预测通常从现在的趋势推到未来，而倒推法更强调目标与路径设计。

summary.en: Backchain means to work backward from a goal to the required steps or facts, especially in AI/logic; it can also mean a language-learning technique of building a sentence from the end.
summary.zh: backchain 指从目标倒推所需步骤/事实（常用于 AI/逻辑的逆向推理）；也可指语言学习中从句尾开始逐步扩展句子的“逆向串联练习”。

definition.en: to reason from a goal (desired conclusion) backward to the facts or steps needed to reach it; to use backward chaining in logic or AI
definition.zh: 从目标（想要的结论）倒推到需要的事实或步骤；在逻辑/人工智能中使用“逆向推理（backward chaining）”

examples.en: The expert system backchained from the diagnosis to the symptoms it needed to confirm.
examples.zh: 这个专家系统从诊断结果开始逆向推理，倒推出需要确认的症状。

examples.en: If we backchain from our deadline, we can plan each step week by week.
examples.zh: 如果我们从截止日期倒推，就能按周规划每一步。

definition.en: to produce or practice a sentence by starting with the last part and adding earlier parts step by step (a language-learning technique)
definition.zh: （语言学习技巧）从句子末尾开始练习，然后一步步往前加，逐段扩展成完整句子

examples.en: In pronunciation class, we backchained the phrase: “for a long time” → “long time” → “time.”
examples.zh: 在发音课上，我们用逆向串联法练习：“for a long time”→“long time”→“time”。

examples.en: Backchaining helps learners say long sentences more smoothly.
examples.zh: 逆向串联练习能帮助学习者更流畅地说出长句。

definition.en: a method of reasoning or teaching that works backward from an end point (goal) to earlier steps; backward chaining
definition.zh: 一种从终点（目标）向前一步步倒推的推理/教学方法；逆向链式推理（backward chaining）

examples.en: Backchaining is common in rule-based AI systems.
examples.zh: 逆向链式推理在基于规则的人工智能系统中很常见。

examples.en: The teacher used backchaining to teach the whole sentence without overwhelming the class.
examples.zh: 老师用逆向串联法来教完整句子，避免让全班觉得太难。

extraExplanation: “Backchain / backchaining”常见于两类语境：① AI/逻辑里的“逆向推理（backward chaining）”，从目标出发寻找能支持它的规则与前提；与“forward chaining（正向推理）”相对。② 语言教学里的“逆向串联练习”，特别适合较长的短语/句子（如重音、连读多的表达），先把句尾说稳，再逐步往前加，提升流利度与节奏感。
拼写上更常见的是 backchain（动词）与 backchaining（名词/动名词）。在一些技术文档里也会看到连字符写法 back-chain，但不如前两种常见。

summary.en: Backchat means rude, impolite replies to someone in authority; it can also mean to talk back.
summary.zh: Backchat 指对权威无礼顶嘴；也可作动词表示“回嘴/顶撞”。

definition.en: impolite, rude replies to someone in authority (such as a parent, teacher, or boss); “talking back.”
definition.zh: 对有权威的人（如父母、老师、上司）无礼顶嘴；回嘴。

examples.en: The teacher warned the class that backchat would not be tolerated.
examples.zh: 老师警告全班不准顶嘴。

examples.en: I got in trouble for giving my mom backchat.
examples.zh: 我因为对妈妈顶嘴而挨骂了。

definition.en: to reply rudely; to talk back (often used in British English).
definition.zh: 无礼地回嘴；顶撞（常见于英式英语）。

examples.en: Don’t backchat your teacher—ask politely instead.
examples.zh: 别顶嘴老师——用礼貌的方式问。

examples.en: He backchatted when his boss corrected him.
examples.zh: 老板纠正他时，他回嘴了。

extraExplanation: “Backchat”在英式英语里更常见；美式英语更常说“talk back”或“sass (someone)”。在学校或家庭语境中，它通常带有“对权威不尊重”的评价色彩。

summary.en: Backchat means a rude reply to someone in authority, or the act of talking back.
summary.zh: backchat 指对权威者无礼地回嘴（名词），也可指“顶嘴”的行为（动词）。

definition.en: an impolite, rude, or disrespectful reply to someone in authority; “talking back.”
definition.zh: 对权威者无礼地顶嘴；回嘴。

examples.en: The teacher warned the class that backchat would not be tolerated.
examples.zh: 老师警告全班不许顶嘴。

examples.en: His backchat to the coach earned him extra drills.
examples.zh: 他对教练回嘴，结果被加练。

definition.en: to answer someone in authority in a rude or cheeky way; to talk back.
definition.zh: （对权威者）无礼回嘴；顶撞。

examples.en: Don’t backchat your parents when they’re explaining the rules.
examples.zh: 父母在解释规则时，不要顶嘴。

examples.en: He got in trouble for backchatting the manager.
examples.zh: 他因为顶撞经理而惹上麻烦。

extraExplanation: “backchat”在英式英语里更常见；美式英语更常用“talk back”或“sass”。你输入的“backchats”是名词复数或动词第三人称单数形式，词条原形是“backchat”。

summary.en: A backcloth is a large cloth backdrop used behind a stage or display.
summary.zh: backcloth 指舞台或陈列后方使用的大块背景布（幕布）。

definition.en: A large piece of cloth used as a background on a stage, set, or display; a backdrop.
definition.zh: （舞台、布景或陈列用的）背景布；幕布；背景幕。

examples.en: The actors stood in front of a painted backcloth showing a city skyline.
examples.zh: 演员站在一块画着城市天际线的背景布前。

examples.en: They changed the backcloth to create a nighttime scene.
examples.zh: 他们更换了背景幕来营造夜景。

extraExplanation: “backcloth”常见于英式英语与戏剧/舞台语境中；在美式英语里更常用“backdrop”。
在剧场里，backcloth通常挂在舞台后方（upstage），用来迅速建立地点与氛围（如森林、宫殿或天空）。

summary.en: Backcomb means to comb hair backward toward the roots to create volume; it can also refer to that teasing technique.
summary.zh: backcomb 指把头发从发梢向发根倒梳来增加蓬松感，也可指这种“打毛/倒梳”的造型手法。

definition.en: to comb hair backward (from the ends toward the roots) to make it look fuller; to tease hair
definition.zh: （为使头发更蓬松而）从发梢向发根倒梳；把头发“打毛/抓蓬”

examples.en: She backcombed her hair to add volume for the updo.
examples.zh: 她把头发倒梳，让盘发看起来更蓬松。

examples.en: If you backcomb too hard, you can damage your hair.
examples.zh: 如果倒梳得太用力，可能会伤害头发。

definition.en: a hairstyle technique where hair is backcombed to create volume
definition.zh: 倒梳（让头发蓬松的）造型手法；打毛

examples.en: The stylist used backcomb at the crown to lift the hair.
examples.zh: 造型师在头顶处用倒梳把头发撑起来。

examples.en: A little backcomb can make fine hair look thicker.
examples.zh: 稍微倒梳一下能让细软发看起来更浓密。

extraExplanation: “Backcomb”在美发语境里常与“tease（打毛）”接近，指把梳子逆着头发生长方向推回去，制造蓬松感。
在宠物/动物梳理中也可能用到，表示逆毛梳理以清理底毛或让毛发蓬松，但最常见还是用于人类发型。
常见搭配：backcomb your hair；backcomb at the roots/crown（在发根/头顶倒梳）。做完后通常会用发胶定型，并轻轻表面梳顺以减少“毛躁感”。

summary.en: Backcountry means a remote area away from towns and main roads; it can also describe outdoor routes or activities in such areas.
summary.zh: Backcountry 指远离城镇和主干道的偏远地区；也可作形容词，描述在这类偏远地区进行的路线或户外活动。

definition.en: a remote, less-developed area away from towns and main roads, often natural and suitable for hiking or camping
definition.zh: 偏远的乡野/荒野地区；远离城镇和主干道、开发较少的区域（常适合徒步、露营等）

examples.en: They went hiking in the backcountry for three days.
examples.zh: 他们去偏远的荒野地区徒步了三天。

examples.en: Always carry a map or GPS when you travel in the backcountry.
examples.zh: 在偏远地区出行时，一定要带地图或GPS。

examples.en: Backcountry travel can be beautiful but risky in bad weather.
examples.zh: 在偏远地区旅行风景很美，但遇到恶劣天气会有风险。

definition.en: located in or relating to remote rural areas (especially for outdoor activities)
definition.zh: 位于偏远乡野的；与偏远地区（尤指户外活动）有关的

examples.en: They took a backcountry route to avoid the crowds.
examples.zh: 他们走了一条偏远的路线来避开人群。

examples.en: Backcountry skiing requires training and safety gear.
examples.zh: 野外滑雪需要训练和安全装备。

extraExplanation: 在美国英语里，backcountry 常用于户外语境，尤其指没有铺装道路、服务设施少的自然区域；与之相对的常见说法是 frontcountry（更靠近公路、游客设施完善的区域）。
与 wilderness（荒野）相比，backcountry 更强调“远离城镇与道路、偏僻难到达”的感觉；wilderness 则更强调“原始、未受人类影响”的自然状态。

summary.en: Backcourt means either the defensive half of a basketball court or the team’s guard players.
summary.zh: Backcourt 指篮球的“后场区域”或“后场（后卫）球员/组合”。

definition.en: (In basketball) the defensive half of the court, from your own baseline to the midcourt line; the area where you bring the ball up after getting possession.
definition.zh: （篮球）后场：从本方底线到中线的防守半场；获得球权后把球推进来的区域。

examples.en: The point guard brought the ball up from the backcourt.
examples.zh: 控球后卫从后场把球运过来。

examples.en: They trapped us in the backcourt and forced a turnover.
examples.zh: 他们在后场夹击我们，逼出了失误。

examples.en: You have 8 seconds to move the ball out of the backcourt in the NBA.
examples.zh: 在NBA里，你必须在8秒内把球带出后场。

definition.en: (In basketball) the players who usually play the guard positions (especially point guard and shooting guard).
definition.zh: （篮球）后场球员：通常指打后卫位置的球员（尤其是控卫和得分后卫）。

examples.en: Their backcourt is small but very quick.
examples.zh: 他们的后场个子不高，但速度很快。

examples.en: The team’s backcourt hit five three-pointers in the first quarter.
examples.zh: 这支球队的后场在第一节投进了五个三分。

extraExplanation: “backcourt”是篮球里的常用术语。第一个意思是“场上的区域”（后场），第二个意思是“球员组合”（后场搭档/后场阵容）。听解说时可以根据上下文判断：如果提到时间规则、推进、夹击，多半是“区域”；如果提到身高、速度、得分，多半是“球员”。
常见相关表达：backcourt violation（后场违例/回场违例，指把球带过中线后又回到后场等违例情况）、backcourt pressure（后场压迫/紧逼）、backcourt duo（后场组合）。

summary.en: A basketball player (usually a guard) who plays mainly in the backcourt.
summary.zh: （篮球）主要在后场活动的球员，通常指后卫。

definition.en: (Basketball) A player who plays mainly in the backcourt (farther from the opponent’s basket), usually a guard responsible for bringing the ball up and organizing the offense.
definition.zh: （篮球）主要在后场活动的球员，通常指后卫，负责推进球、组织进攻等。

examples.en: The team’s backcourt man handled the ball under pressure and set up the offense.
examples.zh: 球队的后场球员在压力下控住球，并组织进攻。

examples.en: He’s a quick backcourt man with strong passing skills.
examples.zh: 他是一名速度快、传球能力强的后场球员。

extraExplanation: “backcourt”在篮球里指后场（通常靠近本方篮筐的一半场地），对应的球员多为控球后卫（point guard）或得分后卫（shooting guard）。更常见的说法是“backcourt player”或直接说“guard”。在一些语境里，“the backcourt”也可以指“一支球队的后卫组合/后场组合”。

summary.en: Backcross means crossing a hybrid back to one of its parents to keep a desired trait; it can also mean the cross itself.
summary.zh: Backcross 指把杂交后代与其亲本之一再次杂交以保留目标性状；也可指这次（或这一代）回交本身。

definition.en: to cross a hybrid organism with one of its parents (or a genetically similar parent line) to obtain offspring that keep a desired trait
definition.zh: （育种/遗传学）将杂交后代与其亲本之一（或与其遗传背景相近的亲本品系）再次杂交，以获得保留某种目标性状的后代

examples.en: Plant breeders backcross the hybrid to the parent with strong disease resistance.
examples.zh: 植物育种者把杂交后代回交给具有强抗病性的亲本。

examples.en: After several generations of backcrossing, most of the offspring’s genome matches the parent line except for the target gene.
examples.zh: 经过多代回交后，后代的基因组大多与亲本品系一致，只保留目标基因的差异。

definition.en: an instance or generation of such a cross
definition.zh: （育种/遗传学）回交；一次（或一代）回交

examples.en: They recorded the results of each backcross in a lab notebook.
examples.zh: 他们把每一次回交的结果记录在实验笔记里。

examples.en: The backcross produced plants that looked like the original variety but carried the new trait.
examples.zh: 这次回交产生的植株外观像原品种，但携带了新性状。

extraExplanation: “back-”在这里表示“回到/再回去”，所以 backcross 常译为“回交”。在作物改良中常见做法是：先杂交引入目标性状（如抗病基因），再不断与优良亲本回交，使后代“外观和大部分基因背景”更接近优良亲本，同时保留目标性状。
常见搭配：backcross to + 亲本（backcross to the recurrent parent）；backcross generation（回交世代）；recurrent parent（轮回亲本/回交亲本）；donor parent（供体亲本）。

summary.en: Backdate means giving something an earlier date than the real one, or making it effective from an earlier time (retroactively).
summary.zh: Backdate 指把日期写早，或让某事从更早时间起追溯生效。

definition.en: to put an earlier date on a document, record, or action than the real date (often to make something seem older or valid earlier)
definition.zh: 把文件、记录或行为的日期写成更早的日期（常为使其看起来更早生效或更早发生）

examples.en: The contract was backdated to January 1 so the benefits would start sooner.
examples.zh: 合同被追溯填为1月1日，这样福利就能更早开始。

examples.en: It’s illegal to backdate some official documents.
examples.zh: 对某些官方文件进行追溯改日期是违法的。

definition.en: to make something effective from an earlier time; to apply retroactively
definition.zh: 使某事从更早的时间起生效；追溯适用

examples.en: The company backdated the pay raise to cover the months you were waiting.
examples.zh: 公司把加薪追溯生效，以补上你等待的那几个月。

examples.en: The rule was backdated, so it applied to past purchases.
examples.zh: 这条规定被追溯实施，因此适用于过去的购买。

extraExplanation: “backdate”在日常语境里既可中性（如工资、福利“追溯生效”），也可能带负面含义（为规避规定而“改早日期”）。是否合规取决于具体情境与法律/公司政策。
相关词：retroactive（追溯的）、effective date（生效日期）、date back to（追溯到……，常用于历史/起源，如“The tradition dates back to…”）。

summary.en: Backdated means dated earlier than the true date, usually for documents or records.
summary.zh: Backdated 指把文件或记录的日期写得早于实际日期（倒填日期）。

definition.en: given an earlier date than the real one (often for paperwork, contracts, or records)
definition.zh: （文件、合同、记录等）被写成比实际更早的日期；倒填日期

examples.en: The contract was backdated to January 1, even though both sides signed it in March.
examples.zh: 合同写成了1月1日生效，尽管双方是在3月才签的字。

examples.en: A backdated receipt can cause problems during an audit.
examples.zh: 倒填日期的收据在审计时可能会引发问题。

definition.en: past form of “backdate”: to put an earlier date on a document than the actual date
definition.zh: “backdate”的过去式：把文件日期写得早于实际日期

examples.en: Someone backdated the form so it looked like it was submitted on time.
examples.zh: 有人把表格倒填日期，让它看起来像是按时提交的。

examples.en: The invoice was backdated to match the accounting period.
examples.zh: 发票被倒填日期以匹配会计期间。

extraExplanation: “Backdated”常见于法律与财务语境。倒填日期有时是出于流程或对账需要（例如让文件对应到某个会计期间），但也可能涉及不当行为（例如伪造提交时间、规避规定）。在正式场合最好说明原因并保留书面记录。
相关搭配：backdated contract（倒签合同）、backdated check（倒填日期的支票）、backdated policy（追溯生效的保险/政策）。

summary.en: “Backdates” means (1) to put an earlier date on a document, or (2) to make something take effect from an earlier date.
summary.zh: “backdates”表示（1）把日期写早（回填日期），或（2）让某事追溯生效。

definition.en: to write an earlier date on a document, check, or record than the true date (often to make it seem older)
definition.zh: 把文件、支票或记录的日期写成早于真实日期（常用于让它看起来更早）

examples.en: He backdates the contract to make it look like the deal was signed last month.
examples.zh: 他把合同回填日期，让它看起来像是上个月就签了。

examples.en: The letter was backdated to match the day the meeting happened.
examples.zh: 这封信被回填日期，以对应会议发生的那天。

definition.en: to make something officially start or take effect from an earlier date than today
definition.zh: 让某事在官方上从更早的日期开始生效（追溯生效）

examples.en: The company backdates her promotion to January 1.
examples.zh: 公司将她的晋升追溯到1月1日生效。

examples.en: Some policies allow coverage to be backdated by a few days.
examples.zh: 有些保单允许保障追溯生效几天。

extraExplanation: “backdate”在正式语境里既可能是中性操作（例如福利或晋升“追溯生效”），也可能涉及不当甚至违法（例如为规避规定而把签署日期写早）。是否允许通常取决于法律、公司制度与是否如实披露。
形式说明：你输入的“backdates”多用于一般现在时第三人称单数（He/She backdates...），也可作为名词复数较少见。

summary.en: Backdating means giving something an earlier date than the real one, sometimes legitimately for an earlier effective date, but often suspected of being misleading or illegal in business and finance.
summary.zh: Backdating 指把日期写成早于实际日期；有时为设定更早的生效日而合法使用，但在商业与金融场景中常因可能误导或违法而受到质疑。

definition.en: the act or practice of putting an earlier date on a document, contract, payment, or record than the true date (often to make it look older or to apply earlier terms)
definition.zh: 将文件、合同、付款或记录标注为早于实际日期的做法（常用于让其看起来更早，或使其适用更早的条款）

examples.en: The auditor discovered backdating on several expense reports.
examples.zh: 审计员发现几份报销单存在倒填日期的情况。

examples.en: The company was investigated for backdating stock-option grants.
examples.zh: 该公司因倒填股票期权授予日期而接受调查。

definition.en: to put an earlier date on something than the real one
definition.zh: 把某事物的日期写成早于实际日期

examples.en: Someone was backdating invoices to move revenue into last quarter.
examples.zh: 有人把发票倒填日期，以把收入挪到上个季度。

examples.en: The form was backdated to match the day the agreement was reached.
examples.zh: 这份表格被倒填日期，以与达成协议的那一天一致。

extraExplanation: “Backdating（倒填日期）”在英语中是中性描述词：有时是合法的行政处理（例如双方确实在某天达成一致，只是后来补签文件，并清楚记录真实签署时间与生效时间）；但在财务、税务、证券、保险等场景中，用来误导或获取不当利益的倒填日期可能构成欺诈或违法。判断关键通常在于是否透明披露、是否造成误导或不当获利。
常见搭配：backdating documents/contracts/invoices/stock options（倒填文件/合同/发票/股票期权日期）。在合规写作里也常用更明确的表达：“effective as of + 日期（自某日生效）”，以避免被理解为故意造假。

summary.en: Backdoor means a rear entrance, or a secret/indirect (often unfair) way to do something; in computing, it can mean a hidden access method to a system.
summary.zh: Backdoor 指建筑物的后门，也可比喻“走后门”的秘密/非正式途径；在计算机领域指系统的隐藏访问通道（后门）。

definition.en: a door at the back of a building, often used as a secondary or less public entrance
definition.zh: （建筑物的）后门；后面的出入口（常用于次要或不公开的进出）

examples.en: Please use the backdoor so you don’t disturb the meeting in the front room.
examples.zh: 请走后门，这样就不会打扰前面房间的会议。

examples.en: The restaurant staff enters through the backdoor.
examples.zh: 餐厅员工从后门进出。

definition.en: a secret, indirect, or unofficial way to achieve something (often seen as unfair)
definition.zh: （达成目的的）秘密途径／后门；非正式或不正当的门路（常带负面含义）

examples.en: They tried to get in through the backdoor instead of applying normally.
examples.zh: 他们试图走后门，而不是按正常程序申请。

examples.en: The policy change created a backdoor for avoiding the rules.
examples.zh: 这项政策变动为规避规则开了后门。

definition.en: a hidden method of accessing a computer system or software, sometimes placed on purpose and often used by hackers
definition.zh: （计算机系统/软件的）后门；隐藏的访问通道（可能被刻意留下，也常被黑客利用）

examples.en: The security team found a backdoor in the app and removed it.
examples.zh: 安全团队在这个应用里发现了后门并将其移除。

examples.en: Attackers installed a backdoor to keep access even after a password change.
examples.zh: 攻击者安装了后门，即使改了密码也能继续访问。

definition.en: secret or indirect; done in an unofficial way
definition.zh: 走后门的；暗地里进行的；非正式的

examples.en: They were accused of making a backdoor agreement.
examples.zh: 他们被指控达成了一项暗箱协议。

examples.en: The law has a backdoor loophole.
examples.zh: 这条法律有一个“后门式”的漏洞。

extraExplanation: “backdoor”用于比喻时，常见搭配有 backdoor deal（幕后交易/暗箱操作）、backdoor entry（通过非公开方式进入/获得资格）。在新闻语境里往往带有“不透明、不公平”的评价色彩。
科技语境中的 backdoor（后门）不一定都是恶意的：有时是开发者为维护或测试留下的隐藏入口，但如果未公开或未妥善保护，就可能变成严重的安全风险。

summary.en: Back down means to give up or retreat from a position; backdown is the act of doing so.
summary.zh: back down 表示在立场上退让/让步；backdown 表示“退让”这一行为（名词用法较少见）。

definition.en: to retreat from a position or decision; to admit you were wrong or stop opposing someone
definition.zh: 退让；让步；收回立场（承认错误或停止对抗）

examples.en: He refused to back down, even under pressure.
examples.zh: 即使在压力下，他也拒绝退让。

examples.en: The company finally backed down and apologized.
examples.zh: 这家公司最终让步并道歉了。

definition.en: a retreat from a position or decision; an act of giving in
definition.zh: 退让；让步；收回立场（这一行为）

examples.en: Her backdown surprised everyone on the team.
examples.zh: 她的让步让团队里的每个人都很惊讶。

examples.en: Some people saw the policy change as a backdown.
examples.zh: 有些人把这次政策变化看作一次退让。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：back down from + 名词/动名词（从某立场/主张退让），back down on + 名词（在某事上让步）。语气上常带“被迫/在压力下才让步”的感觉。
拼写提醒：更常见写法是分开写 back down（动词短语）。作为名词 backdown 较少见，也常写作 back-down 或写成 backdown（尤其在新闻/评论中）。

summary.en: Backdrop means the background behind a scene (especially in theater/photo) or the broader context that explains events.
summary.zh: backdrop 指（舞台/照片等的）背景，也可指解释事件的更大背景或环境。

definition.en: A background setting behind something on a stage, in a photo/video, or in a scene; the background that frames what you see.
definition.zh: （舞台、照片、视频或场景中的）背景；衬托主体的背景环境。

examples.en: The mountains make a beautiful backdrop for the village.
examples.zh: 群山为村庄提供了美丽的背景。

examples.en: They took a family photo with the city skyline as a backdrop.
examples.zh: 他们以城市天际线为背景拍了张全家福。

examples.en: The actor spoke in front of a painted backdrop.
examples.zh: 演员在一块绘制的背景幕布前讲话。

definition.en: The circumstances or history that helps explain a situation; the broader context behind events.
definition.zh: （解释事情的）背景情况；来龙去脉；大环境。

examples.en: To understand her decision, you need to know the backdrop of her childhood.
examples.zh: 要理解她的决定，你需要了解她童年的背景。

examples.en: The novel is set against the backdrop of World War II.
examples.zh: 这部小说以第二次世界大战为背景。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：against the backdrop of…（以……为背景）；in the backdrop（在背景里，较少用，更常说 in the background）。
词源小提示：back + drop（“后面垂下来的东西”），最初指舞台后方垂挂的布景幕布，后来引申为“背景/大环境”。
学习提醒：backdrop 更强调“衬托、映衬”的效果，语气比 background 更有“画面感”。

summary.en: Backdrops are background screens used in theater/film/photo, or the broader setting/situation behind an event.
summary.zh: Backdrops 指舞台/影视/摄影用的背景幕布，也可指事件发生的整体背景或大环境。

definition.en: A large painted cloth or background screen used on a stage, in a studio, or for photos/film.
definition.zh: （舞台、摄影棚、电影或拍照用的）背景幕布；背景板

examples.en: The actors stood in front of a mountain backdrop.
examples.zh: 演员站在一幅群山背景幕布前。

examples.en: We set up a white backdrop for the photo shoot.
examples.zh: 我们为这次拍摄搭了一个白色背景布。

definition.en: The general setting or background of an event; the situation in which something happens (often figurative).
definition.zh: （事情发生的）背景；（尤指）大环境、形势（常为比喻用法）

examples.en: The negotiations took place against the backdrop of rising prices.
examples.zh: 谈判是在物价上涨的大背景下进行的。

examples.en: Her story is told against the backdrop of World War II.
examples.zh: 她的故事以第二次世界大战为背景展开。

extraExplanation: “Backdrop”最常见于戏剧、电影、摄影语境：指实体的“背景布/背景板”。在新闻与写作中也常用作比喻：against the backdrop of… = “在……的大背景下/在……的形势下”。
你输入的“backdrops”是复数形式；单数是“backdrop”。

summary.en: “Backed” usually means “supported” or “moved backward,” and it can also describe something “backed by” support/guarantee or having a backing/lining.
summary.zh: “Backed”常指“得到支持”或“向后移动/倒退”，也可表示“由……支持/担保（backed by）”或“有背衬/靠背的”。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle of “back”) to support someone or something; to agree with or help them.
definition.zh: （back 的过去式/过去分词）支持、赞同或帮助某人/某事。

examples.en: The manager backed her decision in the meeting.
examples.zh: 经理在会议上支持了她的决定。

examples.en: The proposal was backed by several community groups.
examples.zh: 这项提案得到了多个社区团体的支持。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle of “back”) to move or drive backward.
definition.zh: （back 的过去式/过去分词）向后移动；（车辆）倒退。

examples.en: He backed the car into the parking space.
examples.zh: 他把车倒进了车位。

examples.en: She backed away from the angry dog.
examples.zh: 她从那只生气的狗旁边往后退开。

definition.en: Supported or guaranteed by something (often used in “backed by …”).
definition.zh: 由某物支持或担保的（常用于“backed by …”结构）。

examples.en: The loan is backed by the house as collateral.
examples.zh: 这笔贷款以房子作为抵押担保。

examples.en: The medicine is science-backed, not just based on opinions.
examples.zh: 这种药物有科学依据支持，不只是主观看法。

definition.en: Having a backing/lining or a back part added (e.g., fabric, chairs, books).
definition.zh: 有背衬/里衬的；带靠背的；有背面加固的（如布料、椅子、书）。

examples.en: Choose a backed rug so it doesn’t slip.
examples.zh: 选一块带背衬的地毯，这样不容易滑。

examples.en: They sat on a high-backed chair.
examples.zh: 他们坐在一把高靠背椅上。

extraExplanation: “backed by …”非常常见，表示“在……支持/担保之下”，既可用于人（backed by her team），也可用于机构/证据（backed by research）。
注意区分：backed（支持/倒车）与backing（n. 支持；衬里）。例如：The plan has strong backing（这个计划有强力支持）。

summary.en: “backen” is German for “to bake,” and it’s not a standard English word.
summary.zh: “backen”是德语里“烘烤/烘焙”的意思，不是标准英语单词。

definition.en: (Not standard in English) A German verb meaning “to bake,” especially bread, cakes, or other foods in an oven.
definition.zh: （非标准英语用词）德语动词，意思是“烘烤/烘焙”，常指在烤箱里烤面包、蛋糕等。

examples.en: In German, “Ich backe Brot” means “I bake bread.”
examples.zh: 在德语里，“Ich backe Brot”意思是“我烤面包/我做面包”。

examples.en: She learned to backen Christmas cookies with her grandmother (German usage).
examples.zh: 她跟奶奶学着烤圣诞饼干（德语用法）。

extraExplanation: “backen”是德语基础动词之一（原形backen；常见变位如：ich backe/du backst/er backt；过去式常见buk或backte；过去分词gebacken）。在英语写作中一般不用“backen”，通常直接用英语“bake”。如果你想表达英文含义，可能你要找的是“bake”或“baking/ backing”。

summary.en: Backend means the server-side or behind-the-scenes part that supports how a system works.
summary.zh: Backend 指系统的后端/服务器端或幕后支撑部分。

definition.en: (Computing) The server-side part of a website or app that handles data, logic, and connections to databases/services (not the user interface).
definition.zh: （计算机）网站或应用的“后端/服务器端”，负责数据处理、业务逻辑，以及与数据库/服务的连接（不直接呈现给用户的界面部分）。

examples.en: The app is slow because the backend is overloaded.
examples.zh: 这个应用很慢，因为后端负载过高。

examples.en: I work on the backend, so I don’t design the UI.
examples.zh: 我做后端，所以不负责设计界面（UI）。

examples.en: The backend stores user accounts in a database.
examples.zh: 后端把用户账户信息存到数据库里。

definition.en: The less visible or less public part of an organization, process, or system that supports what people see.
definition.zh: （引申）组织、流程或系统中不太显眼/不对外的支持性部分。

examples.en: The backend of the project is managing budgets and schedules.
examples.zh: 项目的“后端”在管理预算和进度。

examples.en: A lot of backend work happens before the event.
examples.zh: 活动开始前会有很多幕后（后端）工作。

definition.en: Relating to the backend (server-side) part of a system.
definition.zh: 与后端（服务器端）有关的。

examples.en: She’s a backend developer.
examples.zh: 她是后端开发工程师。

examples.en: We need a backend solution for authentication.
examples.zh: 我们需要一个用于身份验证的后端方案。

extraExplanation: 你输入的 **backened** 通常是拼写错误；更常见的正确拼写是 **backend**（也常写作 **back-end**）。
在软件领域里常与 **frontend/front-end（前端）** 对比：前端负责用户看到的页面与交互；后端负责数据、权限、接口（API）与业务逻辑。
口语里也常把后端说成“幕后/支撑部分”，不一定只限于技术场景。

summary.en: “Backening” is not standard; you probably mean “beckoning” = signaling someone to come, or seeming inviting/tempting.
summary.zh: “backening”不是标准拼写；你大概率想写“beckoning”，意思是“招手示意过来”，或“显得很诱人/在召唤”。

definition.en: (Likely intended) “beckoning”: making a gesture (often with a hand) that signals someone to come closer; inviting or calling.
definition.zh: （很可能是你想写的）“beckoning”：做手势（常用手）示意某人靠近；引诱、召唤。

examples.en: She stood at the door, beckoning me to come in.
examples.zh: 她站在门口，招手示意我进去。

examples.en: The warm lights of the café looked beckoning on a cold night.
examples.zh: 寒冷的夜里，那家咖啡馆温暖的灯光显得很诱人。

definition.en: “Beckoning” as the -ing form of “beckon”: to signal or call someone to come; to attract or tempt.
definition.zh: “beckoning”作为动词“beckon”的-ing形式：招手示意某人过来；吸引、诱使。

examples.en: He was beckoning to us from across the street.
examples.zh: 他在街对面向我们招手。

examples.en: A new job in the city was beckoning.
examples.zh: 城里的一份新工作正在吸引着他（向他招手）。

extraExplanation: “backening”不是常见或标准的英语拼写。最接近、最常见的词是“beckoning”。如果你原本想表达“支持/做后盾”，可能是“backing”（支持、资助）；如果你想表达“后退”，可能是“backing up”。你可以告诉我句子原文，我能帮你精确判断。
“beckon”常见于文学或较书面语境：不仅指“招手”，也常用来拟人化表达“某处/某机会在召唤你（很诱人）”。

summary.en: A backer is someone who supports a person or project, especially by providing money or public support.
summary.zh: backer 指支持某人或某个项目的人，尤指提供资金或公开声援的人。

definition.en: a person or group that supports someone or something (for example, a plan, project, or political candidate), often by giving help, influence, or public approval
definition.zh: （某人或某事的）支持者；拥护者（常指提供帮助、影响力或公开声援）

examples.en: She has many backers in the local community.
examples.zh: 她在当地社区有很多支持者。

examples.en: The candidate tried to win over undecided backers.
examples.zh: 这位候选人试图争取尚未决定立场的支持者。

definition.en: a person or organization that provides money for a business, project, or event; an investor or sponsor
definition.zh: 出资者；投资人；赞助方（为企业、项目或活动提供资金）

examples.en: The startup is looking for backers to fund its next product.
examples.zh: 这家初创公司正在寻找出资者来资助下一款产品。

examples.en: The film’s backers expected it to succeed at the box office.
examples.zh: 这部电影的投资方希望它在票房上成功。

definition.en: someone who contributes money to a crowdfunding campaign (often in exchange for rewards)
definition.zh: （众筹平台上的）支持者；出资人（常以回报/奖励作为交换）

examples.en: The campaign reached its goal after 2,000 backers pledged support.
examples.zh: 在2000名支持者出资后，这个众筹项目达成了目标。

examples.en: Backers will receive the product early as a reward.
examples.zh: 支持者将作为回报提前收到产品。

extraExplanation: “backer”来自动词“back”（支持、资助）。在商业语境里更常指“出资者/投资人”，在政治或社会语境里更偏“拥护者/支持者”。
在众筹语境中，“backer”通常不是传统意义的“股东”，而是“出资支持者”，回报往往是实物、体验或优先购买权。

summary.en: A backer is someone who supports a person or project, often by providing money; in some sports, it can also mean a defensive player.
summary.zh: backer指支持某人或某项目的人（常指出资者/赞助者）；在某些体育语境中也可指防守队员。

definition.en: A person or organization that supports someone or something, especially by giving money or resources.
definition.zh: （尤指提供资金或资源的）支持者；资助者；后援者

examples.en: The project found a backer who paid for the first prototype.
examples.zh: 这个项目找到了一个资助者，为第一个原型买单。

examples.en: She thanked her backers after she won the election.
examples.zh: 她在赢得选举后感谢了她的支持者。

examples.en: The film’s backers wanted to see a clear plan for marketing.
examples.zh: 这部电影的出资方希望看到清晰的营销计划。

definition.en: In sports, a defensive player positioned behind others (used mainly in certain sports contexts).
definition.zh: （体育）后卫；后场队员（主要用于特定运动语境）

examples.en: He played as a backer on defense in college.
examples.zh: 他大学时在防守端担任后卫/后场队员。

examples.en: The coach moved one backer closer to the line.
examples.zh: 教练把一名后卫/后场队员前移到更靠近阵线的位置。

extraExplanation:
在日常英语里，backer最常见的用法是“出资者/赞助者/支持者”，尤其常见于商业、创业、政治竞选、电影或艺术项目（例如：financial backers）。

词源上，backer来自动词back（支持、在背后撑腰），表示“在背后支持的人”。

常见搭配：a major backer（主要出资方/大金主）, backers and sponsors（支持者与赞助商）, early backers（早期支持者）。

summary.en: “Backers” means supporters—especially people who provide money or strong support for a project, business, or person.
summary.zh: “Backers”指支持者/资助者，尤指为项目、企业或个人提供资金或强力支持的人。

definition.en: People who support or help a person, plan, or organization, often by giving money, approval, or influence.
definition.zh: 支持者；资助者（常指通过金钱、认可或影响力来支持某人、计划或组织的人）

examples.en: The film was completed after new backers provided funding.
examples.zh: 在新的资助者提供资金后，这部电影终于完成了。

examples.en: The candidate thanked her backers for their support.
examples.zh: 这位候选人感谢支持者对她的支持。

examples.en: The startup is looking for backers to help launch its first product.
examples.zh: 这家初创公司正在寻找支持者来帮助推出第一款产品。

extraExplanation: “backers”是“backer”的复数。常见于商业与政治语境，尤其是创业融资（investors/financial backers）与竞选活动（political backers）。在众筹平台上，backers通常指“出资支持项目的人”，不一定拥有股权。

summary.en: “Basket” usually means a container for carrying things; in sports (especially basketball), it can also mean a scored shot or the goal.
summary.zh: “Basket”通常指“篮子”；在运动（尤其篮球）中也可指“进球/得分”或“篮筐”。

definition.en: A container (often woven) used to hold or carry things.
definition.zh: 篮子；（常为编织的）用来装或提物品的容器。

examples.en: She put the apples in a basket.
examples.zh: 她把苹果放进篮子里。

examples.en: He carried a picnic basket to the park.
examples.zh: 他提着野餐篮去公园。

definition.en: (Sports) The act of scoring, or the goal itself, especially in basketball.
definition.zh: （运动）得分；（尤指篮球）投进的一球／篮筐（引申为“进球/得分”）。

examples.en: He made a basket at the buzzer.
examples.zh: 他在蜂鸣声响起时投进一球。

examples.en: That basket tied the game.
examples.zh: 那一球把比分追平了。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“backet”通常是拼写错误，更常见的正确拼写是“basket”。
在美式英语里，篮球语境中常说“make a basket”（投进一球），也会用“basket”直接指“得分/进球”。

summary.en: Backfall most commonly means a wrong-way slope (reverse gradient) in a drain/pipe; it can also mean a backward fall or, more rarely, a counterclockwise wind shift.
summary.zh: Backfall 最常见指排水管/沟槽的倒坡（反坡）；也可指向后摔倒，较少见时指风向逆时针（向左）转变。

definition.en: (Engineering/Plumbing) An incorrect slope that goes the wrong way (a reverse gradient), especially in a drain or pipe, causing water to flow back or pool instead of draining properly.
definition.zh: （工程/管道）坡度方向错误的“反坡/倒坡”，尤指排水管或沟槽的坡度做反了，导致回流或积水而不易排走。

examples.en: The inspector found a backfall in the shower drain, so the water kept pooling.
examples.zh: 检查人员发现淋浴排水有倒坡，所以水一直积在那儿。

examples.en: Fix the backfall by regrading the trench before you lay the pipe.
examples.zh: 下管前先把沟槽重新找坡，把倒坡问题修正。

definition.en: A backward fall; the act of falling onto your back.
definition.zh: 向后摔倒；仰面跌倒。

examples.en: He lost his balance and took a backfall on the icy steps.
examples.zh: 他没站稳，在结冰的台阶上向后摔了一跤。

examples.en: Wear a helmet—one backfall can cause a serious head injury.
examples.zh: 戴好头盔——一次向后摔倒就可能造成严重的头部受伤。

definition.en: (Nautical/Meteorology) A shift in wind direction counterclockwise (toward the left).
definition.zh: （航海/气象）风向逆时针变化（向左转）。

examples.en: The captain noted a backfall in the wind and adjusted the course.
examples.zh: 船长注意到风向向左转了，于是调整了航向。

extraExplanation: “backfall”是由 back + fall 组合而成的复合词。日常英语里并不算常见；在英式/工程语境中更常见的说法是“backfall/negative fall”，而在美式工地口语里也常直接说“the pipe has a backfall（管子倒坡了）”。
气象/航海里表示风“向左转”的意思，有时会用更常见的词“backing (of the wind)”来表达。

summary.en: “Backfatter” is a very uncommon word; it can mean someone who adds pork back fat to meat mixtures, but it’s often a misspelling (commonly of “backfitter”).
summary.zh: “backfatter”非常少见；可指在肉馅/香肠中加入猪背膘的人，但也常见于拼写错误（更常见的是 backfitter，指改装/加装者）。

definition.en: (Very rare / nonstandard) A person who adds back fat (fat from an animal’s back, especially pork) into a meat mixture, such as sausage, to increase richness and moisture.
definition.zh: （非常少见/非标准用法）指在肉制品（如香肠）中加入“背膘/背部脂肪”（尤其是猪背部脂肪）的人，用来增加油润度和多汁感。

examples.en: The butcher acted as a backfatter, mixing pork back fat into the sausage for a juicier texture.
examples.zh: 那位屠夫起到“加背膘”的作用，把猪背膘拌进香肠里，让口感更汁润。

examples.en: Some traditional recipes rely on a backfatter to keep lean meat from drying out.
examples.zh: 有些传统配方会需要“加背膘”的人来避免瘦肉变柴。

extraExplanation: “backfatter”并不是常见英语词汇，很多时候可能是拼写错误或行业里的临时用法。
如果你想表达“改装/加装（设备）的人或公司”，更常见的词是 backfitter（把新设备加装到旧车/旧系统上）。如果你告诉我你看到这个词的句子或领域（汽车改装/肉类加工/用户名等），我可以帮你判断最准确的意思。

summary.en: In American football, “backfield” means either the offensive players behind the line (especially the QB and running backs) or the area behind the line; it can also mean a behind-the-scenes role.
summary.zh: “backfield”在美式橄榄球中指争球线后方的后场球员（尤指四分卫与跑卫）或后场区域；也可引申为“幕后角色/支援位置”。

definition.en: (American football) The group of offensive players who line up behind the line of scrimmage, especially the quarterback and running backs.
definition.zh: （美式橄榄球）进攻方站在争球线后方的一组球员，尤指四分卫和跑卫。

examples.en: The quarterback in the backfield scanned the defense before the snap.
examples.zh: 争球开始前，后场的四分卫观察着防守阵型。

examples.en: Their backfield is fast, so the defense has to tackle well in open space.
examples.zh: 他们的后场速度很快，所以防守方必须在空旷区域做好擒抱。

definition.en: (American football) The area of the field behind the line of scrimmage.
definition.zh: （美式橄榄球）争球线后方的场地区域。

examples.en: The pass was caught in the backfield, resulting in a loss.
examples.zh: 传球在后场被接到，结果倒退码数。

examples.en: A defender broke into the backfield and sacked the quarterback.
examples.zh: 防守球员冲入后场并擒杀了四分卫。

definition.en: (Figurative) A supporting or less visible role; working behind the scenes rather than in the spotlight.
definition.zh: （引申）幕后/不显眼的角色；在台前之外提供支持。

examples.en: She prefers a backfield role, helping the team with planning and logistics.
examples.zh: 她更喜欢幕后角色，协助团队做规划与后勤。

examples.en: He stayed in the backfield while others handled public speaking.
examples.zh: 别人负责公开发言时，他留在幕后支持。

extraExplanation: “Backfield”最常见于美式橄榄球语境：既可以指“后场球员”（quarterback、running backs等），也可以指“争球线后方区域”。解说里说“in the backfield”有时会让学习者混淆，需要结合上下文判断是“人”还是“位置”。

summary.en: “Backfields” is the plural of “backfield,” meaning either (1) the players/area behind the line in American football, or (2) the fields at the back of a farm or property.
summary.zh: “backfields”是“backfield”的复数，可指（1）美式橄榄球中争球线后方的球员/区域，或（2）农场/地产后面的田地。

definition.en: (Sports, especially American football) The players positioned behind the line of scrimmage (the “backs”), or the area behind the line where they line up. “Backfields” is the plural form of “backfield.”
definition.zh: （体育，尤指美式橄榄球）进攻线（争球线）后方的球员（后卫群），或他们站位的区域。“backfields”是“backfield”的复数。

examples.en: The coach tried different backfields to find the best combination of speed and power.
examples.zh: 教练尝试了不同的后卫组合，想找到速度与力量最好的搭配。

examples.en: Their defense kept pressuring the backfields, so the quarterback had to throw quickly.
examples.zh: 他们的防守持续施压后场，四分卫只能快速出手传球。

definition.en: The back or less-visible parts of a farm, property, or area of land (often fields behind a house or main buildings).
definition.zh: （农场、地产等的）后面的田地；不显眼的后方区域（常指房屋或主要建筑物后面的田地）。

examples.en: We walked through the backfields behind the barn to reach the river.
examples.zh: 我们穿过谷仓后面的田地，走到河边。

examples.en: The sheep were grazing in the backfields all afternoon.
examples.zh: 羊群整个下午都在后面的田里吃草。

extraExplanation: 在美式橄榄球里，backfield 常指进攻方的“后卫群”（如跑卫 running back、全卫 fullback），也可以指防守方的“后场”（defensive backfield）。具体含义通常要看上下文（offensive/defensive）。

summary.en: Backfill means to fill something back in (like soil in a trench), to add missing data later, or to cover someone’s job temporarily.
summary.zh: Backfill 指把沟槽等回填、事后补录缺失数据，或在职场中临时顶岗/补位。

definition.en: to fill a hole, space, or trench by putting soil or other material back in
definition.zh: （用土或其他材料）回填；填回（坑、沟、空隙）

examples.en: After the pipes were installed, the workers backfilled the trench.
examples.zh: 管道安装好后，工人把沟槽回填了。

examples.en: Don’t forget to backfill around the tree roots to keep it stable.
examples.zh: 别忘了在树根周围回填土，让它更稳固。

definition.en: to add missing information or data later so the record becomes complete
definition.zh: （事后）补填（缺失信息/数据）；补录

examples.en: We need to backfill the missing dates in the spreadsheet.
examples.zh: 我们需要把表格里缺失的日期补填完整。

examples.en: The clinic hired temporary staff to backfill patient records.
examples.zh: 诊所雇了临时员工来补录病历记录。

definition.en: to cover a job or responsibilities that someone else normally does, especially temporarily
definition.zh: （临时）顶岗；补位（接替他人的工作/职责）

examples.en: A senior engineer will backfill while she’s on parental leave.
examples.zh: 她休育儿假期间，一位资深工程师会来顶岗。

examples.en: They backfilled the night shift with contractors for two months.
examples.zh: 他们用外包人员临时补上夜班，两个月。

extraExplanation: “backfill”常见于三类语境：1）工程/园艺（回填沟槽、地基、树坑）；2）数据/行政（补录缺失信息，让记录完整）；3）人力资源（顶岗/补位）。在职场语境里常与“position/role”搭配，如 backfill a role/position。

summary.en: Backfilled means filled in again (especially a trench or hole), or replaced someone in a job role after they left.
summary.zh: Backfilled 指“回填（沟槽/坑洞等）”，也可指“在人员离开后补上岗位人手”。

definition.en: (Construction/engineering) To fill a hole, trench, or space again, usually with soil or other material after work is finished.
definition.zh: （建筑/工程）把洞、沟槽或空隙回填，通常是在施工完成后用土或其他材料填回去。

examples.en: After the pipe was installed, the crew backfilled the trench and leveled the ground.
examples.zh: 管道安装好后，施工队把沟槽回填并把地面整平。

examples.en: The contractor said the area was backfilled with gravel to improve drainage.
examples.zh: 承包商说该区域用碎石回填以改善排水。

definition.en: (Work/HR) To replace a person in a job or role after they leave or move to another position.
definition.zh: （职场/人事）在某人离职或调岗后，补上（其岗位/角色）的人手。

examples.en: When she was promoted, her old position was backfilled within a month.
examples.zh: 她升职后，她原来的岗位在一个月内就补齐了人手。

examples.en: We backfilled his role with a contractor until hiring was finished.
examples.zh: 在招聘完成前，我们用外包/合同工暂时顶替他的岗位。

extraExplanation: “backfilled”是动词“backfill”的过去式/过去分词。工程语境里很常见（如管沟回填、基坑回填）。在职场语境里多用于招聘与组织调整，强调“补位/补人”，常见搭配：backfill a position / backfill a role。

summary.en: A backfiller fills a gap—either extra content/a substitute, or (in construction) material used for backfilling.
summary.zh: backfiller 指“填补空缺的东西/补位的人”，也可指（施工中的）“回填材料”。

definition.en: a person or thing that fills an empty space, time slot, or missing part; something used as a temporary substitute
definition.zh: 填补空缺的人或事物；临时顶替/补位的东西

examples.en: The producer used a short interview as a backfiller while they fixed the audio problem.
examples.zh: 制作人用一段简短采访当作填充内容，等他们修好音频问题。

examples.en: We need a backfiller for the last two minutes of the show.
examples.zh: 我们需要一个内容来填补节目最后两分钟的空档。

definition.en: (construction) material used to fill a hole or trench after work is done (backfill)
definition.zh: （建筑/施工）回填材料；用于把坑或沟槽填回去的土石等

examples.en: Gravel is a common backfiller around drainage pipes.
examples.zh: 碎石常用作排水管周围的回填材料。

examples.en: They chose clean sand as the backfiller to reduce settling.
examples.zh: 他们选择干净的砂作为回填材料，以减少沉降。

extraExplanation: “backfiller”来自动词短语“backfill”（回填/填回去）。在媒体、排程或活动组织里，它也常指“填充内容/补位的人或环节”，用来填补时间空档或临时缺口。

summary.en: Backfilling usually means refilling an excavated hole or trench; by extension, it can also mean adding missing information later or covering staffing gaps.
summary.zh: Backfilling 通常指施工中的“回填”；也可引申为事后补齐缺失的信息/工作，或在排班与用工上“补缺/补位”。

definition.en: the process of putting soil, sand, or other material back into a hole, trench, or space after digging or construction work
definition.zh: （施工中）回填：在挖掘或安装完成后，把土、砂或其他材料重新填回坑、沟或空隙的过程

examples.en: After the pipe was installed, the crew started backfilling the trench.
examples.zh: 管道安装好之后，工人开始回填沟槽。

examples.en: Proper backfilling helps prevent the ground from sinking later.
examples.zh: 正确回填有助于防止地面日后下沉。

definition.en: the act of adding missing work, information, or records later to cover an earlier gap
definition.zh: （事后）补做/补充：在发现之前有缺口后，再把工作、信息或记录补上

examples.en: We spent Friday backfilling the documentation we skipped during the rush.
examples.zh: 我们周五在补写之前赶工时跳过的文档。

examples.en: The analyst is backfilling last month’s data in the report.
examples.zh: 分析师正在把上个月遗漏的数据补进报告里。

definition.en: filling past schedule gaps or missing shifts, often by assigning staff to cover them
definition.zh: （排班）补班/补缺：把过去未覆盖的班次或岗位补上，常指安排人员顶上

examples.en: HR is backfilling the night shifts that were left uncovered.
examples.zh: 人力资源正在补上之前没人顶的夜班。

examples.en: They hired contractors for backfilling during the hiring freeze.
examples.zh: 在冻结招聘期间，他们雇了外包人员来补缺。

extraExplanation: “Backfilling”来自动词“backfill”，常见于工程/市政语境（回填沟槽、地基等）。在办公或数据语境里，它常被引申为“把缺的内容事后补齐”，如补文档、补数据、补记录。
在职场里也会说“backfill a position”（补某个岗位的人），意思是有人离职/调岗后找人补上；“backfilling”可指这一补位过程。

summary.en: Backfills means (1) fills an excavation or empty space again, or (2) adds missing information later; it can also mean the material used to fill a hole.
summary.zh: backfills 可指（1）把挖开的坑/沟“回填”，或（2）在数据/工作中“事后补齐信息”；也可指回填材料。

definition.en: (v.) to fill an empty space or hole again, especially by putting soil, sand, or other material back into an excavation (a trench, a foundation hole, etc.).
definition.zh: （动词）回填；把挖开的坑、沟等重新用土、砂等材料填回去（常用于工程/施工语境）。

examples.en: The workers backfill the trench after the pipe is installed.
examples.zh: 管道安装好后，工人会把沟槽回填。

examples.en: Don’t backfill until the inspector checks the foundation.
examples.zh: 在检查员检查地基之前不要回填。

definition.en: (v.) in data/work contexts, to add missing information later; to update past records with newly available data.
definition.zh: （动词）在数据/工作语境中，事后补齐缺失的信息；用新获得的数据补全过去的记录。

examples.en: The team backfills missing addresses from older customer files.
examples.zh: 团队从旧客户档案中回补缺失的地址信息。

examples.en: We need to backfill last month’s reports before the audit.
examples.zh: 审计前我们需要补齐上个月的报告。

definition.en: (n.) the material used to fill a hole or space again, such as soil, gravel, or sand; also, the act/result of doing this.
definition.zh: （名词）回填材料（如土、碎石、砂等）；也可指回填这一行为/结果。

examples.en: Gravel is often used as backfill for drainage.
examples.zh: 碎石常用作排水回填材料。

examples.en: Poor backfill can cause the ground to sink later.
examples.zh: 回填不好可能导致地面日后下沉。

extraExplanation: “backfills”通常是动词第三人称单数（He/She/It backfills）或名词复数（different backfills）。常见于施工、管线工程、园艺，以及数据/运营中“补数据”的场景。
工程语境里，backfill 与 fill 的差别在于 backfill 强调“挖开之后再填回去”，并且常涉及分层夯实（compaction）以避免沉降。

summary.en: Backfire means something goes wrong and has the opposite effect, or (literally) an engine or gun fires backward; it can also mean the bad result itself.
summary.zh: backfire 指事情适得其反；也可指（字面）发动机或枪回火；还可作名词表示“反噬/适得其反的后果”。

definition.en: To produce the opposite result from what was intended; to go wrong in a way that causes trouble for the person who started it.
definition.zh: 产生与预期相反的结果；适得其反（让发起者反而吃亏）。

examples.en: His attempt to look confident backfired, and everyone noticed how nervous he was.
examples.zh: 他想装得很自信，结果适得其反，大家都看出他很紧张。

examples.en: The harsh message backfired and made customers trust the company less.
examples.zh: 那条强硬的信息适得其反，让顾客更不信任这家公司。

definition.en: To explode or burn backward (especially of a gun or engine), or to make a sudden loud pop from the engine.
definition.zh: （枪或发动机）回火；（发动机）发出“砰”的回火声。

examples.en: The old car backfired as he started the engine.
examples.zh: 他发动引擎时，那辆旧车回火了。

examples.en: The gun could backfire if it isn’t maintained properly.
examples.zh: 如果保养不当，这把枪可能会发生回火。

definition.en: An unexpected harmful result; a plan that hurts you instead of helping you.
definition.zh: （意外的）反噬结果；适得其反的后果。

examples.en: The policy was meant to help, but it became a political backfire.
examples.zh: 这项政策本来是想帮忙，但却成了政治上的反噬。

examples.en: Posting that joke online turned into a backfire for his reputation.
examples.zh: 他把那个玩笑发到网上，结果对名声造成反噬。

extraExplanation: “backfire”原本来自机械/枪械语境，指火焰或爆炸“往回”窜；后来引申为做法或策略“反过来伤到自己”，因此在日常英语里最常见的是比喻义“适得其反”。
常见搭配：backfire on someone（对某人产生反噬/反作用），例如：It backfired on him.（这事反过来害了他。）

summary.en: “Backfired” means something went wrong and produced the opposite result you wanted; it can also mean an engine or gun made a loud “backfire” sound.
summary.zh: “backfired”表示事情适得其反、结果与预期相反；也可指发动机或枪支“回火”发出爆裂声。

definition.en: (Of a plan, action, or remark) to have the opposite effect from what was intended, causing problems or harm instead of helping.
definition.zh: （计划、行动或话语）适得其反；产生与预期相反的效果，反而带来麻烦或伤害。

examples.en: My joke backfired and offended her.
examples.zh: 我的玩笑适得其反，把她冒犯了。

examples.en: Their attempt to ban the book backfired and made more people want to read it.
examples.zh: 他们试图禁书，结果适得其反，让更多人想去读。

definition.en: (Of an engine or gun) to make an explosive sound or send force in the wrong direction because something is not working correctly.
definition.zh: （发动机或枪支）回火；因故障而发出爆裂声或产生反向冲击。

examples.en: The car backfired when I started it in the cold.
examples.zh: 天冷时我启动车子，它发生了回火（发出爆裂声）。

examples.en: The old rifle backfired, so he stopped using it.
examples.zh: 那支旧步枪回火了，所以他不再使用。

extraExplanation: “backfire”原义来自枪械：火药气体从枪管“向后”冲出，伤到射手或造成故障。后来引申为更常见的比喻义：想达到某个目的，结果反而让情况变糟。
常见搭配：a plan backfired（计划失败/适得其反）；It backfired on me.（我自食其果/反而害了自己）；backfire badly（严重适得其反）。

summary.en: Backfires means something goes wrong and has the opposite result you intended; it can also mean an engine makes a loud pop (a backfire).
summary.zh: backfires 表示事情适得其反、弄巧成拙；也可指发动机回火发出“砰”的爆响（回火声/回火现象）。

definition.en: (of a plan, action, or comment) to have the opposite effect from what was intended; to cause trouble for the person who did it
definition.zh: （计划、行为或言论）适得其反；产生与预期相反的效果；反而给做这件事的人带来麻烦

examples.en: His attempt to look cool backfires, and everyone laughs at him.
examples.zh: 他想显得很酷的做法适得其反，结果大家都笑他。

examples.en: If you lie now, it may backfire later.
examples.zh: 如果你现在撒谎，以后可能会适得其反。

examples.en: The strict rule backfires by making students even more rebellious.
examples.zh: 这条严厉的规定适得其反，反而让学生更叛逆。

definition.en: to cause an engine to make a loud popping sound because fuel burns at the wrong time (or in the exhaust)
definition.zh: （使发动机）回火；（因燃油在错误时间/排气管内燃烧而）发出“砰砰”的爆响

examples.en: My old car backfires when I start it on cold mornings.
examples.zh: 我的旧车在寒冷的早晨启动时会回火。

examples.en: The motorcycle backfired loudly on the street.
examples.zh: 那辆摩托车在街上大声回火。

definition.en: a loud popping sound from an engine caused by fuel burning at the wrong time; the event of this happening
definition.zh: （发动机的）回火声；回火现象

examples.en: I heard a backfire and thought it was a gunshot.
examples.zh: 我听到一声回火，还以为是枪声。

examples.en: The mechanic said the backfires were caused by a faulty spark plug.
examples.zh: 修理工说回火是因为火花塞故障。

extraExplanation: “backfire”原本常指发动机/枪械的“回火、反喷”，后来在日常英语里更常用作比喻：做某事本想达到好结果，却“反噬自己/弄巧成拙”。
你输入的“backfires”多见于：①动词第三人称单数（It backfires.）②名词复数（Engine backfires.）。

summary.en: Backfiring most commonly means something has the opposite effect from what was intended; it can also mean an engine/gun making a sudden misfire sound.
summary.zh: backfiring 最常指“适得其反”；也可指发动机或枪支回火/误燃产生的爆响。

definition.en: (of a plan, comment, or action) having the opposite effect from what was intended; causing trouble for the person who started it
definition.zh: （计划、言论或行为）适得其反；反而对发起者不利

examples.en: His joke about her accent ended up backfiring and made him look rude.
examples.zh: 他拿她口音开玩笑结果适得其反，让他显得很没礼貌。
